Le groupe Jappo a été crée le 22 Juillet 2011 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois. Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, la responsable du groupe est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.

Elle vend de l'huile de palme, du sucre, du lait. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquer pendant plus de cinq années. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en huile, sucre et lait pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et surtout de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Jappo was created on July 22, 2011 when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group comprises sixteen women who are all from the same village. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Standing at the extreme right in the photo, the group's official is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She sells palm oil, sugar, and milk, She has good experience in this domain for having worked in it for over five years. 

This loan will enable her to stock up on oil, sugar, and milk to resell. 

With the profits she will make from her business, she plans on supporting her husband to support the family and  especially to provide an education for the children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (oil, sugar, milk....)

loans.name: Bokk Xol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 mars 2001. Il est  composé de quatorze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Salimata, à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus teintés. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis une dizaine années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 22, 2001. It is made up of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

Madame Salimata, on the right, raising her hand, is the group leader. She is 31 and single, without children. She sells dyed cloth. She has a good deal of experience in this field as she has been in it for some 12 years. This loan will allow her to grow her working capital and better develop her business. 

The profit will permit her to improve living conditions for the family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and set aside more in savings.

loans.use: to buy dyed cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more timber to use at his workshop.

loans.name: Nguidile Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Nguidile a été inauguré depuis le 15 décembre 2008, il compte 28 femmes mais seulement 25 ont sollicité le prêt, elles sont issues du même village et ont le petit commerce comme activité principale.

Madame Coumba la responsable est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants,elle mène un commerce de tissus et produits cosmétiques, elle vend également des beignets dans le quartier et à l'école pendant l'année scolaire. Elle est debout à droite à l'extrême habillée en bleu et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achéte ses tissus ( voile, bazin,khartoum....) et produits cosmétiques dans un pays frontalier pour revendre dans son village.


Elle envisage avec son prêt agrandir et diversifier ses produits afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices obtenus subvenir aux besoins de sa famille sur le plan sanitaire et scolaire, mais aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Nguidile "village bank" was inaugurated on December 15, 2008. It numbers 28 women, but only 25 have requested this loan. They come from the same village and small-scale retailing is their main activity.  

Madame Coumba, the leader, is 42. She is married and the mother of two children. She sells cloth and cosmetics. She also sells doughnuts in the neighborhood and at the school during the school year. She is standing on the far right, dressed in blue and raising her left hand.  

She buys various sorts of cloth (sheer, damask, "Khartoum", etc.) and cosmetics in a bordering country for resale in her village. She expects to use her loan to grow her business and diversify her products so as to make more income. 

With the profit, she hopes to cover needs of her family in terms of healthcare and school expenses, but also put aside more in savings.

loans.use: to buy cloth and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008, il est composé de dix huit femmes qui sont parentes, amies et voisines, elles s'activent dans le petit commerce et l'aviculture.


Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 28 ans, mariée mère de deux enfants, elle a une nièce en charge; elle mène une activité de petit commerce avec une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en vert olive avec un pagne multicolore.


Elle achéte des habits pour enfants, parfum.... dans la capitale et revend dans son quartier.


Avec son prêt elle compte renforcer son activité en achetant beaucoup de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et de gagner beaucoup de revenus.


Elle participe aux dépenses familiales pour soutenir son mari à améliorer les conditions de vie des enfants.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom solidarity group was formed on December 15, 2008. It is made up of 18 women who are relatives, friends and neighbors. They work at small-scale retailing and poultry-raising. 

Madame Awa, the group leader, is 28, married, and the mother of two children. She is also responsible for a niece. She has a good deal of experience in her small-scale retail business. In the photo she is standing on the far right, dressed in olive green with a multicolored print wrap as a skirt. 

She buys clothing for children, perfume, etc. in the capital and sells the merchandise in her neighborhood. With her loan she intends to expand her business by buying a lot of goods so as to respond to the needs of her clientele and earn more income. She helps her husband to support the family and improve living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics destined for resale.

loans.name: Beg Lu Baax Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Beg Lu Baax qui signifie vouloir le meilleur est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008, il est composé de 15 femmes qui entretiennent de bonnes relations et qui s'activent dans le petit commerce et l'élevage.


La responsable madame Ndéye Khady est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée mère de sept enfants dont deux filles;elle fait de l'aviculture et de l'embouche, elle a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en robe bleue.


Elle achéte au marché central de la ville 10 poussins de race bleu hollande pour une rotation, les revend après deux mois dans son quartier et reprend l'opération.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter trois béliers à élever pour faire une opération Tabaski et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettent de participer à l'épanouissement de ses enfants sur tous les plans.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Beg Lu Baax (meaning 'to want the best') was created on December 15, 2008. It is composed of fifteen women who keep up good relations and who are active in small-scale commerce and in livestock farming.

The group's official, Ms. Ndéye Khady, is 42 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, including two girls. She raises poultry and fattens livestock. She has good experience. In the photo, she is the one in a blue dress and standing at the right.

At the city's central market, Ms. Ndéye Khady buys 10 chicks of the Bleu Holland species for one rotation. She resells them in her district after two months and then starts the process over again. 

She wishes to use her loan to buy three head of male sheep to raise for the purposes of Tabaski (a sheep festival) and thus to bring in a lot of revenues. 

The profits obtained will enable her to help her children to thrive in all ways.

loans.use: to buy sheep and chicks to raise

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a firewood vendor, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She has been engaged in her business for two years. In addition, she operates a retail shop business, which allows her to earn a small additional income. Her primary challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. 

Mwanatumu and her husband have three school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is school fees.

With the KSHS 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

Her major dream is to expand her business endeavor in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to offer for sale

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima, a divorced mother of two boys and three girls, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwanalima has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the business challenges of seasonality and competition from other food vendors in the area, and dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, Mwanalima wants to purchase sacks of cassavas, coconuts and utensils to be used in the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cassavas, coconuts and utensils to be used in the business.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, single and lives with four family members, one of whom works.

Salem has owned a market since 2006, selling all kinds of barley and wheat. He has good experience in this field and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Laneya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Il est  composé de sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Dioutala qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 34ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir  pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 12, 2011. It is comprised of seven women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small businesses. 

Ms. Dioutala, who is the one with her hand raised in the photo, is the group's official. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She is active in selling vegetables. She has good experience in this domain for having worked in it for several years.

This new loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her businesses further. 

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc....) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip, located in Palestine. Mohammad is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. He will get married soon, and because his salary is not enough to pay for wedding expenses such as purchasing home furniture and appliances, he is in need of a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN.

When Mohammad gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay easily for wedding expenses and live his coming life in better home conditions.

Mohammad is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and appliances for his wedding.

loans.name: Bocar Salamata Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Il est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama, est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 33ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle détient un petit restaurant où elle vend du petit déjeuner, déjeuner et diner. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was founded on June 12, 2008. The group consists of fifteen women who all live in the same district. They are mainly involved in small business activities.

The leader of the group is Madame Mariama, who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised. She is 33 years old. She is married and has one child. She also looks after two other children entrusted to her care by relatives.

She runs a small restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has been working in this field for many years and has a good deal of experience in this sector. 

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and expand her business.

The profits will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, two girls and two boys. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six months, she has operated a business selling charcoal from her home to neighbors and passersby. Rehema’s major business challenge is the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to her location. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Rehema is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 51 years old and married. She lives with her family in the village of Ketilari, Abasha. Dali is a farmer and works with her husband Oleg and her 18-year-old daughter. The family's farm has five milk cows and 2.5 hectares of land in cultivation with haricot, maize, and soybeans. Dali produces and sells an average of 95 kilograms of traditional Georgian cheese at the local open market along with most of the vegetables harvested by the family. The family’s total average income is 900 GEL.

Dali is requesting a loan to renovate her family’s house as it is old and in bad condition. Although Dali and Oleg work hard, they have not been able to save money to repair their house. After the renovation, the family will have better living conditions and can rest properly after their hard work during daytime.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house without electricity running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, she has operated a food vending business and she sells food door-to-door and from her home. Asha’s greatest business challenge is competition from other food vendors in the area. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Asha is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase ingredients and utensils for her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils for her business

loans.name: Yawavi Adéline

texts.fr:
Yawavi Adéline est une femme  âgée de 23 ans. Elle est célibataire 
Yawavi Adéline travaille comme revendeuse des produits d’alimentation depuis 2009.
 Elle sert ses clients à AGOE après achat à LOME. 
Yawavi Adéline a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation.
texts.en: Yawavi Adéline is a 23-year-old woman who is unmarried. She has been working as a retailer grocer since 2009. After making her purchases in LOME, the capital of Togo, she serves her customers in AGOE. She has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES in order to buy grocery items.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Johnston

texts.en:
Johnston is a married man with three children. Two of his children attend school and the other is still too young. Johnston lives in a rented house with electricity but no running water and his greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are passersby and his major business challenge is the high cost of fuel. Johnston decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

Johnston is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase another motorcycle and increase his income and savings. In the future, he dreams of purchasing more motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama est une femme  âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un gendarme avec 02 enfants en charge.
Adama travaille comme revendeuse de céréales, riz, arachide depuis 2004. Elle vend seule à domicile après achat à ANIE et BLITTA.
Adama a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin de renforcer son activité en achetant des céréales, du riz et de l’arachide.
texts.en:
Adama is a 36-year old woman. She is married to a policeman and has two dependent children.
Adama works as a vendor of cereals, rice and peanuts [ground nuts] since 2004. She sells by herself, out of her home, after stocking up in [the villages of] Anie and Blitta.

Adama is requesting her first-cycle loan from WAGES in order to strenghten her business by stocking up on cereals, rice and peanuts.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, beans, sorghum, peanuts etc)

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old and married with three children who go to school. For the past eight years, he has sold stationery to earn a living for his family. He employs two people. Through Faulu Kenya, John has been able to access business loans which have helped him to improve his business. He has also participated in business management trainings to improve his skills.

John is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy a printer. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a printer

loans.name: Wasse Walaboe

texts.fr:
Wasse Walaboe est une femme âgée de 51ans. Elle est mariée å un attaché d’administration. Elle a 03 enfants.
 Wasse Walaboe travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 1999. Elle vend dans un marché de la place à toutes personnes après achat au marché de DATCHA, ANIE et ATAKPAME. 
Wasse Walaboe a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
texts.en:
Wasse Walaboe is a woman of age 51. She is married to an administrative officer. She has three children. 

Wasse Walaboe has been working as a reseller of grain since 1999. She sells to the public in a marketplace after purchasing grains at the markets of Datcha, Anie, and Atakpame. 

Wasse Walaboe has requested a second loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase grain.

loans.use: to buy grain.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 31 years old, married and has 2 children in school. She operates a cafeteria so as to earn a living for her family. She started her business 2 years ago and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management. This has helped her to run her business well.
Lucy hopes to open a restaurant in the future. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy utensils.

loans.use: to buy utensils

loans.name: Mekdad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has two children.

Mekdad has owned a cafeteria since 2006. There he prepares all kind of drinks and foods. He has good experience in this field and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. His cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials – cement, sand, stones, etc. for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали проживает в районе Яван. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование. Он мастер, занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того Муродали занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Murodali lives in the Yavan region. He is 39 years old. He is married with three children. His wife is a homemaker. He has vocational training. 
He is foreman and works in construction for hire. Besides this, Murodali practices animal husbandry. He raises calves for future sale. He has been doing this work for 10 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 32 years old, married and has a 6-year-old child. To earn a living, she runs a grocery store. She has retained her business for 7 years due to her good services. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care skills.

Fridah dreams of owning a mini-supermarket in the future. She has requested 30,000 KES to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is from the village Pirveli Maisi, Samegrelo Region. She is 52 years old, unmarried and lives with her family: 41-year-old brother and parents (retired). Clara and her brother are leading the agro business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. In particular, the family has 3 milk cows. Clara produces, on average, 60 kg of cheese per month. She sells it on the local open market. Also, they own a pig and sell approximately 10 piglets per year. Along with the above-mentioned, Clara and her brother have 1 hectare of land where maize is grown. One ton of the harvested corn is sold on local market and the remaining 2 tons are used for feeding the livestock. 

Along with the above-mentioned, Clara has a small trade business. She brings seasonal clothes from Tbilisi wholesale market to the village and sells them. She brings the new clothes with the value of 200 – 300 GEL twice a month. Her monthly profit from this business is 200 – 250 GEL per month. 

Clara requested credit for purchasing additional clothes for resale. She will purchase more clothes and offer a wider assortment to the villagers. Also purchasing the clothes in larger amounts will allow her to save transportation costs. Clara will get more profit and will be able to make some savings, because in the near future she will need to change the roof of the house.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Jusu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 7,000,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they can buy or invest in things that their salaries alone cannot cover. 

Jusu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 52-year-old was born in Kenema city. He is married and has 5 children – 2 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 1 in college. Jusu has been a professional teacher for 35 years now. He has joined his colleagues to request a loan of 1,000,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has two children.

Hussein is a blacksmith. He has owned a workshop since 2002. He makes doors and windows. He has good experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to buy a generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
For the past 21 years, Abdujabbor has worked in agriculture raising animals.  He raises cattle which he cares for greatly since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses.  Abdujabbor's cattle have been vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. Abdujabbor, is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that in the future he can earn more money. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bahromkhuja

texts.en:
Bahromkhuja is married, with two children. He sells men’s clothing in the the market. Bahromkhuja’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 2 years. He is very good with people. He has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him be successful in the competitive clothing market. Bahromkhuja’s biggest dream is to have financial independence and a decent livelihood for his family. He hopes the current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a businesswoman who operates a hardware shop. She has been running her business for eight years and employs two people to assist her. To supplement her income, Pauline also raises poultry.  

Pauline is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy mash and chicken feed. She is determined to improve her poultry business and become the major supplier of eggs and chicken to hotels in her community.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Hotamjon

texts.en:
Hotamjon is a devoted father who has dedicated himself to his livestock. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his family, composed of his wife and 3 children.  Hotamjon raises livestock for sale. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family, which really needs it. Today Hotamjon looks for support from IMON International to obtain the necessary loan to purchase cows to raise.  With this loan his beloved family will benefit as much as he will.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. 

For the past 10 years Muhabbat has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business after her husband's contract with the construction company he was employed was ended. With her husband’s income missing, bills started to pile up, and she decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. 

Currently Muhabbat has requested a loan in the size of $1000 USD to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. This is an important matter for this family's well-being. She truly appreciates your generosity.

loans.use: Purchase office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.en:
Ozoda is 20 years old. Ozoda runs her own business in order to help support her family. She sells jewelry. Ozoda has been in this business for more than two years. Today Ozoda needs additional capital to purchase new items such as earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains. She wants to increase the variety of products she sells. This is Ozoda's second loan, and she promises to repay the loan according to the terms, as she has done with her previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase of new jewelry items such as earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 38 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She has a business selling beer and soda in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for two years.

Rebecca requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more beer, soda and water to sell

loans.name: Williams' Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group has come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 2,900,000 SLL to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, group members repay the loan from their salaries.  

This group’s leader is Williams, who is 50 years old. He was born in Kamboma, a place in eastern Sierra Leone. Williams is married to a teacher and the couple has five children, two of whom are in primary school and three who are in secondary school. Williams is requesting a 1,000,000 SLL loan to buy materials to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is married and has one child. She sells men’s clothing at the central market. Farogat has been in this business for five years. She decided to start her business because she needed to provide for her growing family. Shirts and trousers are always in demand, so Farogat decided to sell them. She is a hard-working person and desires to develop her business even more. Farogat would like to receive a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase seasonal shirts, trousers, and suits for the coming season. She hopes that the loan will help her to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, trousers, and suits

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Kuña Arandu, se conformó en  el año 2009, gracias a  la una D. las miembros, quien se acerco a la oficina D. la Fundación Paraguaya para informarse del programa, y contacto con la asesora para la formación D. un nuevo grupo y  logró juntar a 16 mujeres en sus inicios pero actualmente son 21 integrantes quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el séptimo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Señora Carolina se dedica a la confección D. ropas, gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención D. la casa. Comenta que está llena D. trabajo, ya que muchas personas se acercan a ella a llevarle muchos encargos. Uno D. sus sueños es poder agrandar su taller y tener más máquinas D. costura con lo que podrá atender más trabajos D. los clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, agujas hilos y demás, los cuales son materiales esenciales para su trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Arandu” Women’s Committee was formed in 2009 thanks to one of the members who came by the Fundación Paraguaya office to find out about the program and contacted an advisor to form a new group.  She gathered together 16 women at the beginning but currently there are 21 members who are working very comfortably and very hard and very dedicated in a cooperative, mutually supportive way in their seventh cycle within the program.

Carolina is a dressmaker.  Thanks to this occupation she’s been able to obtain income necessary to support her household.  She comments that she has a lot of work since many people come to her and place many orders.  One of her dreams is to enlarge her workshop and to have more sewing machines to meet customers demand.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, needles, thread and others which are the essential materials needed for her work.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles and others.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper; Abdurahim's business is the main source of income for his family. For the past eight years, Abdurahim has been providing transportation services. He also has a cattle-breeding business. Abdurahim wants all of his children to be well-educated, which is one reason why he works so hard. As a result of his hard work, the business generates an income that allows him to support his large family. In order to provide better service for his clients, Abdurahim needs to make major repairs to his truck. He also wants to buy more cattle. He believes that these things will make his business more profitable. For this reason, he is requesting 3,000 USD.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his truck and to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 50 years old and lives with her husband Tamaz and her mother-in-law, who is 83 years old and retired. She is from Samtredia, Imereti District. The family’s only income source is their agricultural activities. Nato and her family have a small dairy farm with three milk cows and she produces an average of 45 kilograms of traditional Georgian cheese each month to sell on the local open market. The family also has a small pig farm with two pigs and they sell piglets each month. Nato and Tamaz feed their domestic animals mainly with maize that is cultivated on their one hectare of land. The family’s total income, including the pension of Nato’s mother-in-law, is 950 GEL. 

Nato is requesting a loan to purchase an additional milk cow to produce and sell more cheese to increase her income. She hopes that when their income increases, she will be able to save some funds to renovate her kitchen to have better conditions for making cheese.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase meat and construct a small kiosk

loans.name: La Alborada Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad D. Santaní se unen 10 amigas y vecinas con el objetivo D. generar ingresos para que D. esa manera cada una D. ellas puedan ayudar o sustentar los gastos D. la casa. Ellas se definen como mujeres muy luchadoras y trabajadoras, el sueño D. todas ellas es que sus familiares tengan un mejor estilo D. vida y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro del que ellas tuvieron.
La Señora Rosa se dedica a la cría D. cerdos, ella se dedica a esto hace ya muchos años. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar con la manutención D. la casa. Comenta que tiene mucha clientela, ya que a la hora D. faenar los cerdos vienen muchas personas. Uno D. sus sueños es tener una granja granD. donD. pueda tener más animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. animales y también para la compra D. balanceados para los mismos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que D. obtener el crédito, este le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
In the city of Santaní, 10 friends and neighbors have come together with the purpose of creating income so that that way each one of them can be able to help with or proviD. for their home expenses. They define themselves as strong, hard-working women. Each one dreams that her relatives will have a better way of life and that her children will have a better future than she did. 
Sra. Rosa raises pigs, and has spent many years raising them. Thanks to this work, she has been able to get ahead and help with household costs. She comments that she has many customers, since many people come when it is time to slaughter the pigs. One of her dreams is to have a large farm where she can have more animals.
She requests the loan to buy animals and also to buy healthy feed for them. She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity this loan gives her, since the loan will proviD. her with lots of help.

loans.use: To buy animals and healthy feed for them.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old and married. She supports a family of four people. She is engaged in poultry farming and has been doing this for a period of five years. She was given a loan of KES.60,000/=  which she invested in poultry. She earns a monthly income of KES.90,000/=.

She wants to purchase more chicks with the loan and the anticipated profit she will earn. Since this is her second loan, she was able to repay her first loan with ease. She hopes to buy a vehicle for transportation and public service.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy films, connect and  pay  for the Digital SateliteTelevision (D.S.T.V)

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
Maulidi, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children; two of them go to school. He has  a business making and selling improved traditional clay cook stoves.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy clay, iron sheets, a hammer and scissors and he has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to make more improved traditional clay stoves to sell. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Express" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To make more improved traditional clay stoves to sell.

loans.name: Idrissa S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. Loans are offered to teachers and other salaried workers so as to empower them to buy or invest in things that their salaries cannot let them invest in. For example, some of these teachers can use the loan to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a family house; some will use it to buy pieces of furniture or pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, their bursar repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Idrissa is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kenema 43 years ago, Idrissa is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children – one in primary school and the other is not of school-going age. Idrissa has requested a loan of 500,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El Señor Bernardino, tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, vive en la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 6 hijos, una trabaja como niñera, otra ya esta casada y vive en la ciudad de Pedro Juan Caballero, otro estudia todavía y otro trabaja con él en la Olería. El señor trabaja en una Olería hace más de 10 años.
Él se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, ya que de a poco ha logrado ir creciendo pese a los contratiempos que han surgido. Uno de sus suenos es que todos sus hijos se conviertan en personas de bien, con una profesión digna y decorosa. En cuanto a su trabajo, le gustaría poder tener un taller más amplio con lo cual podré atender a más clientes, y de esa forma generar más ingresos para su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de materias primas para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Esta muy esperanzado en el crédito, ya que de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Bernardino, aged, 48, is married and lives in the city of Concepción.  He has six children; one daughter works as a childminder; another daughter is married and lives in the city of Pedro Juan Caballero; one of his sons is still a student, and another works with him in his brick-making operation.  The Señor has been working in a brick-making operation for more than ten years.

He describes himself as a very hard-working and striving man, as he has slowly been able to grow in spite of the setbacks that have arisen.  One of his dreams is for all his children to grow into good people., with a dignified and decent profession.  As for his work, he would like to be able to have a bigger workshop with which he could serve more customers, and in this way earn more income for his family.

He is asking for the loan to buy raw materials for making bricks.  He is very hopeful about the loan, as obtaining it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 33 years old and supports her children who  ages ten and seven years old.  She owns a boutique that has been in operation for eight years earning a monthly income of KES. 8,100.

Florah has borrowed KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD. She hopes to use the money to purchase more business stock like clothes,shoes,bags etc for her business.The anticipated profit will be used to improve and expand the business.

In the future, Florah hopes to purchase a vehicle which will be used for public transport, to develop her plot of land and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase business stock such as clothing, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena, 43 years old, is married to Julius and they have four children.  She owns a grocery shop which has been in operation for thirteen years earning a monthly income of KES.3,900.

Flomena is borrowing a loan of KES.50,000 from KADET. It is her second loan. She intends to use the loan to purchase more stock like vegetables and fruist etc.The anticipated profit will be used to improve the level of business stock.

Flomena hopes to excel in the business and eventually to start a cereals store.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: La señora Julieta tiene un puesto de venta de ropa  en la feria de la zona 16 de julio los días jueves y domingos; su esposo es chofer y es socio propietario en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa; Julieta necesita el crédito para comprar y  aumentar su mercadería como ser ropa para toda edad , pues esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Ernesto Torres de la ciudad de La Paz. Julieta ha accedido en cuatro anteriores veces a créditos a través de Kiva y desea que esta vez también el préstamos se canalizado a traves de Kiva.
texts.en: Julieta has a clothing stand in the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays.  Her husband is a taxi driver and is an owner member of the Eduardo Avaroa syndicate.  Julieta needs the loan to buy merchandise to increase her stock of clothes for all ages because this activity is her source of income for family support.  She’s married and has two children.  She lives in her own house located in La Paz’s Ernesto Torres zone.  Julieta has accessed four previous loans through Kiva and wishes this loan to be channeled through Kiva as well.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing for all ages.

loans.name: Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTOCABLES” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Plomería, tejido de mantas y venta de tostado

La señora Martha,  indica que hace seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tostados que viene trabajando hace 26 años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tostados) que adquirirá de los almacenes de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en la Chacaltaya, Ceja y en las paradas de minibús. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.
texts.en:
The communal bank "UNTOUCHABLES" will begin it's second cycle with Pro Woman. It is a part of the Los Andes regional office, made up of nine members, directed by board members, and is lead by Mrs. Martha. The businesses the members of the communal association partake in are varied and include: Plumbing, blanket weaving, and tostada (fried maiz tortilla) sales.

Mrs. Martha mentions that she has been working with Pro Woman for six months and became a part of the institution by a friend's invitation. At the moment she has a tsotada business she has been working in for 26 years.

The loan being requested will be used to buy more materials (buy tostadas) which are acquired through the warehouses in Ceja then subsequently sold in Chacaltaya, Ceja, and at the minibus stops. This type of job helps her make money to support her family since she is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Woman, she says she likes the attention they offer.

loans.use: buy tostada (fried maiz tortillas.)

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 34 years old and married to Emma. They are blessed with one child, age two years. Michael has been supplying beverages for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 5,000 which he uses to support his family.

Michael is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy soft drinks to increase his stock. With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. 

Michael hopes are to own a big beverage store and be able to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to increase his stock

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier es chofer y trabaja con su movilidad independientemente en el transporte de pasajeros. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento en general de su vehiculo (cambio de aceites, chequeo de frenos, alineamiento, etc.) Vive en la casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero no  tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también de Kiva.
texts.en: Javier is a taxi driver working independently with his vehicle providing passenger transportation services.  He needs the loan for general service on his car (oil change, brake check, alignment, etc.).  He lives in his parents’ house which is located in the city of La Paz’s Achachicala zone.  He’s single and has no children.  This is his first IMPRO loan and also his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James,32 years old, is married to Grace. They have no children. James has been a milk vendor for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 2,000 which he uses to meet their basic needs. He is applying for his first loan term from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. James will use the loan to buy a refigerator to store milk. 

With the anticipated profit from the business James will venture into dairy farming. His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and keep dairy cows which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to store milk

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es: El señor Alejo es carpintero y su esposa lo ayuda en el trabajo. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir madera y venestas (madera delgada) para terminar un contrato que consiguió. Su trabajo de carpintería le ayuda a conseguir los ingresos que la familia necesita mensualmente. Vive en casa de su hija ubicado en la zona de franz Tamayo en  La Paz. Es casado y tiene una  hija. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente ya que le ayudaron para comprar herramientas que necesita en su negocio. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito pasa a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Alejo is a Carpenter and his wife helps him with his work.  He needs the loan to buy lumber and "venesta" (thin wood) to finish a contract he got.   His carpentry work helps him earn income that the family needs monthly.  He lives in his daughter’s house located in La Paz’s Franz Tamayo zone.  He’s married and has one daughter.  The client is very satisfied with the loans he’s been granted previously because they helped him to buy tools he needs for his business.  This is the second time his loan has gone through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy lumber and "venesta" (thin wood).

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Del Mbachio Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción se formó un comité integrado por 15 amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, todas ellas oyeron hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y quedaron encantadas y de allí nace el grupo denominado Mujeres Emprendedoras de Mbachio, el cual actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo numero 13 del programa. Ellas se definen como mujeres sacrificadas y luchadoras, gracias al trabajo que realizan de forma conjunta han logrado avanzar en los ciclos.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de ropas, hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo cual ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Vende todo tipo de prendas, últimamente ha recibido muchos pedidos de ropas de invierno, por lo que le gustaría agrandar su stock de ropas. Uno de sus sueños es tener un local propio donde ofrecer los productos que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, como ser gorras, camperas, guantes, medias y demás, para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
In the city of Asunción, a committee has formed from 15 friends and neighbors from this city.  All of them heard about the program for entrepreneurial women, and were delighted about it.  From there, the group named "Mujeres Emprendedoras de Mbachio", ("Entrepreneurial Women of Mbachio"), was born.  This group is currently in its thirteenth lending cycle in the program.

They describe themselves as striving women who are willing to make sacrifices, and thanks to their work together, they have succeeded in moving forward in the lending cycles.

Señora Maria  works selling clothes.  She has been doing this for a while, which is why she she has a solid customer base.  Recently, she has received many orders for winter clothes, for which she would like to increase her stock of clothing.  One of her dreams is to have her own premises where she can sell her products.

She is asking for the loan to purchase winter clothing, such as caps, jackets, gloves, socks and other items for subsequent sale.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that is being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell subsequently.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Vanessa trabaja en una tienda donde venden fotocopiadoras y su esposo es chofer de transporte de pasajeros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que la señora se encuentra estudiando ensamblaje de computadoras. Vive en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona 16 de febrero en la ciudad de El Alto. Vanesa es casada y no tiene hijos. Vanesa ya obtuvo dos créditos anteriores a través de Kiva y se encuentra muy satisfecha con la relación existente.
texts.en: Vanessa works in a store where they sell photocopiers and her husband’s a driver providing passenger transportation services.  She needs the loan to buy a computer because she’s currently studying computer assembly.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Febrero zone.  She’s married and has no children.  Vanessa got two previous loans through Kiva and she is very satisfied with the current relationship.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Maelewano Zomboko Group

texts.en:
Chelestina, who is in her early 30s, is divorced with one child who goes to school.  She has been running a pharmacy business for four years now.  She works from 8 a.m to 9 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy medicines, repair the pharmacy shelves, repair the pharmacy floor, take care of her child and has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more medicines for the pharmacy.  Her dream is to one day be able to repair her three-roomed house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Maelewano Zomboko" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Yhenny

texts.es: La señora Yhenny se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y cenas con ayuda de su madre. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: arroz, fideo, carne, así podrá ofrecer a su clientela mayor variedad en el menú que ofrece.  Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de villa  armonía en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera  y tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Yhenny sells lunches and dinners with help from her mother.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients like: rice, noodles and meat so that she can offer a wider variety in the menu she offers.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Armonía zone.  She’s single and has a son.  This is the first time the client has obtained an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 54 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 11 and 27 years old. She takes care of one other relative. Her business is well organized. She has six years of experience and she sells charcoal.

Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, save for the future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: the purchase of more drugs to resell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 42 years old, married to Rehab. They are blessed with three children. He has been a taxi driver as a primary business and has been running a butchery as his secondary business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET. He will use the loan to repair his car and buy more cows for slaughtering.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes are concentrated on his children’s education and improving the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To repair his car and buy more cows for slaughtering.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia se dedica a la venta de periódicos en la zona central. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de periódicos y revistas que es lo que más le piden sus clientes. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Antonio en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que Sonia obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en: Sonia sells periodicals downtown.  She needs the loan to buy newspapers and magazines which are what her customers request the most.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s San Antonio zone.  She’s single and has a son.  This is the first time Sonia’s obtained a loan in IMPRO and also in Kiva.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of newspapers and magazines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy envelopes, pens, and exercise books to add to his stationery shop inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases oil, onion, soap and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Eugenia se dedica a la venta de chompas y trabaja en una empresa de seguros; su esposo se encuentra trabajando fuera del país. El crédito lo requiere para pagar un curso especial para vender seguros. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pura Pura en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un  hijo. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y la primera que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: María Eugenia sells sweaters and also works at an insurance company.  Her husband is working abroad.  She needs the loan to pay for a special course in insurance sales.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Pura Pura zone.  She’s married and has a son.  This is the third loan request to IMPRO and the first time it’s channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an insurance sales course.

loans.name: Mukaushande Group

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Sibongile (raising her hand) from Masvingo, a town in southeastern Zimbabwe. She is married with four children; two attend school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Sibongile runs a flea market business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. Sibongile has requested a loan of $400 to buy blouses, tracksuits, bags, and boots. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. 

In the future Sibongile plans to operate a retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags, and footwear for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 years old and he is married to Joyce. They have no children. He has been running an electronic shop for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to cater to their basic needs.

James is applying for his first loan term with KADET, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy electronic equipment. 

With the anticipated profits from the business he will expand the business. His hope is to open a bigger electronic shop which will cater to his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy electronic equipment.

loans.name: Villa Dolores F Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA DOLORES F” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ruth. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, comerciante de prendas de vestir, tienda, costura de ropa, carnicería, venta de muebles, pollereria, joyería, venta de calzados.

La señora Ruth, indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas para formar un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de aceite, , conservas, cerveza), que comprara de la distribuidora de la Ceja y lo comercializará en el establecimiento de su zona. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la visita ala consultorio y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “Villa Dolores F” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center.  It has ten members led by a governing board headed by Ruth.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: food sales, clothing sales, store, dressmaking, butcher shop, furniture making, chicken shop, jewelry sales and shoe sales.

Ruth indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from friends to start a group.  Currently, she has a neighborhood store that she’s been running for the past two years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase working capital (to buy oil, canned goods, beer).  She will make her purchases at the La Ceja distributor and will sell in her local establishment.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family in whatever way she can because she’s married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health center visits and the training.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, wheat flour and use the rest to enroll his daughter in college.

loans.name: Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Caacupé se unieron con el propósito D. luchar por un mejor estilo D. vida. D. allí surge el comité denominado Las lomas, todas ellas trabajan D. forma conjunta y solidaria, se encuentran muy felices dentro del programa D. la Fundación. Se definen como mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, con mucha creatividad e ingenio.
La presidenta del comité, la señora Leonarda, vive con su marido e hijos. Manifiesta que ellos siempre la ayudan en su trabajo, que es la venta D. comestibles. Ella comenta que hace mucho tiempo se dedica a esto, por lo cual ya tiene una clientela bien formada, tiene mucha demanda, ya que a los clientes les gusta mucho las comidas que ella prepara.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los ingredientes para los alimentos que ella prepara, como ser carne, hortalizas, condimentos, panes y demás. Está con muchas esperanzas en el crédito, pues le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
19 women in the city of Caacupe decided to join forces to fight for a better standard of living. This has developed into the communal bank called Las Lomas. The women work as a supportive and collaborative team and are very happy to be a part of the Fundación. They see themselves as enterprising and hardworking women with plenty of creativity and ingenuity. 

The president of the communal bank, Leonarda, lives with her husband and children. She says that they help her enormously selling her meals. She says that she has been in this business a long time and so has a loyal client base and is in great demand, as the customers really like the food she prepares. She is asking for a loan in order to buy the ingredients for the meals she prepares, such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, bread and the like. She really hopes to obtain the loan as it will help her substantially

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, bread and the like in order to make meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is 35 years old and is married. She has five children between the ages of 10 and 16 years old. Leonille has one year of experience and she works from 6 AM until 8 PM every day. She sells handicrafts in her business.

Leonille has requested a loan from Kiva lender in order to buy more hand crafts to increase her business. With the profits, Leonille will pay school fees for her children and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more hand crafts to sells.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 34 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 7 and 11 years old. He sells clothes. His business is well organized and he works daily from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Venuste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more clothes for resale. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business, to save for his future and to build a house for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Blas Osvaldo

texts.es:
Blas tiene 32 años de edad, está casado con la señora Gloria de 25 años, vive en su casa propia, es vendedor ambulante hace más de diez años y su señora es artesana, fabrica sobrecamas que después son comercializados por su marido.
Blas es muy sacrificado debido a que los días hábiles de semana trabaja como albañil y los fines de semana se va a vender sus productos a la capital y sus alrededores recorriendo varios kilómetros en su moto, realizando las ventas casa por casa. 
Blas empezó como vendedor de un tío suyo por dos años y despues que compró para su moto y con la ayuda de su tío pudo tener su propia microempresa.
Hoy en dia cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de sus productos
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías (edredones, sábanas) debido a que ésta es la época en que más salida tienen dichos productos ya que es invierno en esta parte del mundo.
texts.en:
Blas, 32, is married to Gloria, 25. He lives in his own house.  He’s been a street vendor for over  ten years and his wife’s a craftswoman; she makes bedspreads that are then sold by her husband.

Blas is very self-sacrificed because he works all the working days in a week as a bricklayer and then goes to the capital and its environs on weekends to sell his wares covering several kilometers on his motorcycle selling door to door.

Blas started out working for two years as a salesman for his uncle and later bought his motorcycle and with help from his uncle was able to set up his own micro business.  Today, he has a well-established clientele thanks to his good customer service and the good quality of his products.

He needs the loan to buy merchandise (comforters, sheets) because this season is when this type of product sells the most because its winter in this part of the world.

loans.use: to buy comforters and sheets to resell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 32 years old and married with one child who is 2 years old. He has been operating a well-organized business for one year, selling sorghum for soft drinks. He opens his business from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. daily except on Sunday.

Bernard has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more quantities of sorghum to sell. With the profit, Bernard will reinvest in his business and save for his family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more quantities of sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys forma parte del Banco comunal “Renacer” perteneciente a la comuna de Cerro Navia, ciudad de Santiago. 
Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas, específicamente prepara desayunos y almuerzos. Desde hace 7 años. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en un horario de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 4ºº de la tarde. Su sobrina es quien la ayuda en la preparación de comidas y atención a los clientes. Sus preparaciones son para servir o llevar los alimentos, ya que Gladys cuenta con un comedor en el cual puede atender a 25 clientes, para esto ella debió ampliar la cocina y baño, además reestructurar su casa.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados y carnicerías.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio. 
Sus metas son expandirse y prosperar en su negocio.
Gladys vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 37 y 26 años de edad. Comenta que uno de sus sueños a nivel personal, es realizar un curso de gastronomía que le permita aprender nuevas técnicas y recetas, para entregarle una mayor variedad de productos y mejor atención a su clientela. 
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que le apasiona lo que realiza, además poder brindarle ayuda económica a su madre quien sufre de Alzheimer y su nieto de un año de edad.  
Gladys está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda entregada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y con esto obtener mejores ingresos económicos. 
Comenta que la relación con los demás integrantes del Banco comunal ha sido muy buena, ya que son muy unidos, por lo que además realizan actividades en conjunto. 
Cerro Navia es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada en el sector poniente. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos niveles de pobreza, alta densidad de habitantes por hectárea, falta de espacios para recreación y escasa oferta laboral. El desarrollo económico ha circulado en torno al sector  micro empresarial de productos básicos (alimentos, vestuario, zapatos, licores, etc.).
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer” (To Be Reborn) which is located in the community of Cerro Navia in the city of Santiago. She earns her living by preparing and selling meals, specifically breakfast and lunch. Gladys has been doing this for seven years. She works Monday through Friday and her schedule is from 8am to 4pm. Her niece helps her with preparing the food and attending to the customers. The meals that she prepares are served directly or available for take-out. Gladys has a diner that can accommodate 25 customers, but she wants to have the kitchen and bathroom extended. She also wants to restructure her home.

Gladys buys her supplies from supermarkets and butcher shops. With this loan she plans to buy supplies for her business. Her goals are to expand and prosper her business.

Gladys lives with her husband and two children (ages 37 and 26). She says that one of her dreams on a personal level is to take a cooking class so that she can learn new techniques and recipes. This will enable her to serve a wider variety of dishes and provide better service to her customers. She is motivated to continue with her business because she is passionate about what she does. In addition, she wants to provide financial support for her mother who suffers from Alzheimer’s and her one-year-old grandson. Gladys is very pleased and appreciative of the assistance provided by Fondo Esperanza. This has allowed her to invest in her business and to generate better financial income. In relation to the other members of the Communal Bank, Gladys says that she gets along with them very well. They are very close and work together on various activities.

Cerro Navia is a community in the region of Metropolitana (where the Chilean capital of Santiago is also located) that is situated on the western side of the country. This community is known for having high levels of poverty, high population density per hectare, a lack of recreational spaces, and a shortage of labor. The economic development in this area focuses on micro-enterprises that produce basic goods such as food, clothing, shoes, liquor, and other items.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 43 years old and married with two children. She runs a well-organized business where she sells household items such as bananas, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and so on. She is applying for this loan through Kiva to buy more items to sell to her customers, and intends to reinvest the profits in her business so that she can eventually earn enough money to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas, cooking oil, onions, tomatoes and so on.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel, es rentista jubilado y su esposa es ama de casa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construcción (arena, estuco, cemento, pintura) ya que realizara la refacción de su vivienda. Vive en la casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres  hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel is retired and lives off of his assets.  His wife is a homemaker.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials (sand, stucco, cement, and paint) so that he can finish the repairs to his house.  Miguel lives in his own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.  

Miguel is very pleased with the loans that have been provided so that he can improve the living conditions of his family.  This is the second time he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel trabaja comercializando arena y piedras, las mismas que las transporta en su volketa (camión especial cuya carrocería se voltea para efectos de dejar el producto en el lugar desado) propia. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento en general de su vehiculo ya que es su instrumento de trabajo y trabaja constantemente. Vive en la casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Bajo Llojeta en la ciudad de La Paz; Gabriel es casado y tiene tres  hijos. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007 y esta es la primera vez que su crédito va a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Gabriel sells sand and stone. He transports these materials using a “volketa” (a special truck that has a movable compartment for dumping its contents in the desired place). The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for general maintenance of his vehicle since it is the main piece of equipment that he uses constantly for work. Gabriel lives in his own home in the District of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children.

Gabriel joined IMPRO in 2007 and this is the first time his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the dump truck that he uses for hauling construction materials.

loans.name: Filomena Liliana

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena es madre soltera, tiene 04 hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad que ya no se encuentran a su cargo y los otros dos en edad escolar; la Sra. Filomena se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 10 años, con lo cual gana aproximadamente S/ 300 nuevos soles mensual, el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra con bastante deterioro; su principal desafío que enfrenta es la poca clientela por estas fechas ya que no hay fluidez de personas por donde tiene ubicada su tienda; su sueño de la Sra. Filomena es poder algún día tener una tienda más grande y poder vender más variedad de productos.  Ella se encuentra muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado y por la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en:
Sra. Filomena is a single mother with four children. Two of them are grown and no longer under her care, while the other two are of school age. Sra. Filomena has been selling groceries for 10 years and earns approximately 300 PEN each month.

The loan being provided to her will be invested in improving her home since it is in a deteriorated state. Her main challenge is dealing with the recent decrease in customer traffic into her store, due primarily to her location. Her dream is to someday have a larger store and be able to sell a wider variety of products.

Sra. Filomena is very grateful for the loan that has been provided and the trust that is being demonstrated to her.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for personal use and for tracking her mother's business expenses.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Celia.
