Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: canecería, tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, venta de medias, venta de salteñas, venta de ganado.

La señora Celia, indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne que viene trabajando hace dos años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para  la compra de una heladera, para la refrigeración de la carne, este equipo lo comprará de la Ceja y lo acomodará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud, crédito y ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Celia. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various business activities in order to get ahead such as operating a butcher shop, knitting sweaters, managing a neighborhood store, selling vegetables, selling socks, selling turnovers, and selling livestock.

Sra. Celia says this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from a friend. Celia currently has a business selling meat and has been working for two years.

The loan she is now receiving will be used to buy a refrigerator for preserving meat. This piece of equipment will be purchased in the neighborhood of La Ceja and she will make room for it in her store. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Celia is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Celia said she enjoys the health services, the loans, and the savings.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for preserving meat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more drugs for a pharmacy

loans.name: Jorge Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 49 años de edad, tiene hijos ya adultos, independientes económicamente, y vive en su propia casa, situada en la ciudad de Encarnación. El señor Jorge es mecánico, posee un taller de chapería y pintura desde hace varios años en su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace tiempo, ya que es su vocación. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela, ya que muchos de sus vecinos van a reparar sus vehículos en su taller.
El se considera un hombre muy luchador y emprendedor, ya que pese a los contratiempos que tuvo pudo salir adelante con su negocio. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar su taller con lo cual podrá agarrar a más clientes.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para el taller, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con alguno de los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Jorge is 49 years old.  He has children who are already grown and financially independent, and he lives in his own home, located in the city of Encarnación. 

Señor Jorge is a mechanic.  He has had a workshop in his home for the last several years, where he does bodywork and painting.  He has been working in this field for a while, as it is his vocation.  He says that he has a good customer base, and that many of his neighbors come to repair their vehicles in his workshop.

He considers himself to be a very hard-working and enterprising man, who in spite of setbacks, has been able to move ahead in life with his business.  He comments that everything that he has done is to give his family a better style of life.

One of his dreams is to be able to expand his workshop, so that he can take on more customers.  

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his workshop, as in this way he will be able to deliver on any of his customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his mechanic's workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his cash reserves so that he can purchase a newer taxi.

loans.name: Flor De Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario FLOR DE MARIA esta conformado por cuatro personas 3 mujeres y 1 hombre. 
todos trabajadores y luchadores y que se conocen muy bien.
el grupo esta ubicado en la Aldea El Jobo de la jurisdicción de Nacaome, departamento de Valle.

El señor Javier se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular en su pulpería que tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, Javier es una persona muy simpática, amable, responsable y sobre todo muy respetuosa, sus clientes dan muy buenas referencias de el como persona , como amigo y como comerciante.

El señor Javier en su pulpería vende todos los productos de la canasta Básica Familiar, como ser abarrotaría en general, granos básicos, productos derivados de la leche, embutidos , refrescos, todo tipo de carnes , pollo, agua, cosméticos y productos de aseo personal.

los demas integrantes del grupo son: Ana Mirian se dedica  a la venta de golosinas en la escuela Agrícola, La señora Gloria Araceli se dedica a la venta de tortillas y La señora Ramona se dedica a la extracción y venta de materiales de construcción.

Uno de sus anhelos es ver crecer sus negocios y dejar un mejor sustento a sus hijos y familiares.
texts.en:
The “Flor de María” solidarity group is composed of four people: three women and one man.  All are hardworking and tenacious and know each other very well.  The group is located in the village of El Jobo, Nacaome jurisdiction, Valle Department.

Javier sells items of popular consumption in his home-based grocery store.  He’s been in this occupation for several years.  Javier is a likeable, kind, responsible and, above all, respectful person.  His customers give him very good references as a person, as a friend and as a merchant.

Javier stocks all the basic items a family needs in his store like: groceries in general, basic grains, products derived from milk, cured meats, soft-drinks, all types of meat, chicken, water, cosmetics and personal hygiene items.

The other group members are: Ana Mirian who sells snacks at the Agricultural School, Gloria Araceli who sells tortillas and Ramona who extracts and sells building materials.  One of their wishes is to see their businesses grow and to provide better support for their children and families.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Eduardo; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y también trabaja como docente del nivel secundario, en el negocio de agricultura el socio siembra maíz y después lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Urubamba, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura y mejorar en su trabajo como docente del nivel secundario. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y también para pagar el alquiler del tractor que necesitan para el negocio de agricultura.
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Eduardo is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Jorge Eduardo divides his time between his daily activities and his farming business. He also works as a high school teacher. In his farming business, Jorge Eduardo grows corn and then sells it as a street vendor at the market in Urubamba. He wants to expand and improve his farming business as well as improve in his job as a high school teacher. Jorge Eduardo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for the rental of a tractor that he needs to use for his business.

He is happy with the loan and promised to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for the rental of a tractor.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 23 años vive en Pimampiro que esta a una hora de  Ibarra, vive con sus papas y su hijo que tiene 4 años; se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que le encanta hacer producir a su negocio.

Trabaja en una papelería ubicada en Pimampiro, comenzó con este trabajo hace 5 años, gracias a sus padres empezó con poca mercadería pero gracias a FODEMI a podido crecer su negocio.

Solicita créditos a FODEMI por 5 años y el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de mochilas, cuadernos etc para el inicio del año escolar y así poder incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es abrir más puntos de venta dentro y fuera de Pimampiro para mejorar su calidad de vida gracias a su productividad.
texts.en:
Concepción is 23 years old and lives in Pimampiro, which is an hour away from Ibarra. She lives with her parents and her four-year-old son. Concepción is considered to be a hardworking and enterprising woman who enjoys being productive in her business.

She works in a stationery shop in Pimampiro. Concepción started this job five years ago. Thanks to her parents, she started out with a small amount of merchandise but FODEMI has helped her to grow her business.

Concepción has been requesting loans from FODEMI for five years. The loan she is seeking at the moment will be used to buy backpacks, notebooks, and other items since the school year is starting. This will help increase her sales and improve her income.

Her dream is to open more shops within and outside of Pimampiro so that she can improve her quality of life and be more productive.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, backpacks, and other supplies for the start of the school year.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Yeabu is 60 years old, married, and has six children aged 40, 35, 31, 27, 23 and 19 years. She has two additional dependents, both stepchildren, who live with her.  In 2009, Yeabu started a business selling containers, bowls, and enamel pans. She began her business because she did not want to depend on others in her family and she wanted to make more income for herself.

Yeabu works seven days a week, 10 hours a day, and earns about 1,100,000 Sierra Leonian leones (Le) every month.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and is now asking for a new loan of 4,500,000 Le to buy more containers, bowls, and enamel pans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 Le. In future, Yeabu plans to buy land of her own. She is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more containers, bowls, and enamel pans

loans.name: Tugirubukire B / Rbv Group

texts.fr: Wellars est né  au Rwanda.et il est membre du groupe Tugirubukire. Il est marié, il  a   26 ans, il a 1enfant de 5 mois. Il  a deux ans des études secondaires. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 1 hectare de champ ,200 kgs de pommes de terre, 8kgs d’engrais et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter la production en utilisant des engrais chimique pour récolte plus beaucoup en fin de satisfaire le marché. Pour ses ambitions il voudrait être un grand agriculteur connu dans sa région, et bâtir sa propre maison d’habitation et sa famille.
texts.en: Wellars is born in Rwanda. He is a member of the Tugirubukire group. He is married. He is 26 years old. He has one 5-month old child. He has finished two years of secondary studies. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to purchase 1 ha [about 2.5 acres] of land, 200 kgs [440 lbs] of potatoes, 8 kg [18 lbs] of fertilizers and pay for labor. His business strategy is increasing the production and using chemical fertilizers in order to have a much larger harvest and meet the demand. As to his goals, he would like to become a regionally known farmer and build his own house for his family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for 1 ha [about 2.5 acres] of land, 200 kgs [440 lbs] of potatoes, 8 kg [18 lbs] of fertilizers  and the cost of labor.

loans.name: Las Orquídeas Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Yony está levantando la mano).

La señora Yony nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nacio, ella desde hace 18 años que es viuda y con mucho esmero se dedica a sus dos hijos. Ella es una madre responsable, amable y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria y la podemos encontrar desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a sábado en su puesto de venta. También, ella vende ceviche los días domingos en la puerta del colegio Simón Bolívar en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 17  años que tiene el pequeño negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Yony en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una cocina industrial a gas. 

En el departamento del Cusco, capital Cusco conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América", se reúnen cada treinta días las socias del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas” en la oficinas central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco (Perú). Banco comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y sus actividades económicas de los demás socios son por ejemplo venta de comida, venta de granos, venta de jugos y venta de hierba medicinales.
texts.en:
Sra. Yony was born in the city of Cusco and still lives there. She has been a widow for 18 years and looks after her two children with great care. Yony is a responsible, friendly, and hardworking mother who sells food as a street vendor. She is at her vending stall between the hours of 9am and 3pm, Monday through Saturday. In addition, she sells “ceviche” (marinated seafood) on Sundays on the doorstep of the Simón Bolivar School in the city of Cusco. Yony has been in business for 17 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy an industrial gas stove.

(In the photograph, Yony is the woman raising her hand.)

In the Department of Cusco, the capital city of Cusco has been known for many years as the “Archaeological Capital of the Americas”. The Communal Bank “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) meets every 30 days at the central offices of Asociación Araiwa in Cusco. This Communal Bank consists of hardworking and enterprising individuals who take every moment to find opportunities to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. Most of the members live in the city of Cusco. Some examples of their business activities include selling food, selling grain, selling juices, and selling herbal medicines.

loans.use: to buy an industrial gas stove.

loans.name: Sunnah

texts.en:
Sunnah is 36 years old, married, and has three children aged 15, 11 and 8 years. In 2000, Sunnah established a business selling fabric and slippers.  She chose to sell fabric because she thinks it's something that is always marketable, and she had already gained similar experience working with her elder sister.

Sunnah works six days a week, nine hours a day, and earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leonian leones (Le) every month. Sunnah  has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and is now asking for a loan of 5,000,000 Le in order to buy more fabric and slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 Le.

In future, Sunnah plans to add more goods to her shop. She has already opened another outlet for her younger brother, and she has bought a piece of land with the proceeds of her previous loan. She has been able to take care of her family's needs, and she thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy fabric and slippers

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Dulce Esperanza se formó D. la unión D. varias vecinas y amigas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Ellas se unieron con el propósito D. obtener mayores ingresos, y D. D. esa forma puedan ayudar en la economía D. sus casas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen al compañerismo.
La señora Maria, está casada y no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta D. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser cubiertos, ropas, frazadas, sabanas, calzados, y demás. Ella trabaja muy duro para poder mantener a sus sobrinos que quedaron huérfanos siendo muy chicos y que ahora viven con ella. Se considera una mujer muy creativa y llena D. sueños. Uno D. sus mayores anhelos es poder tener un local donD. ofrecer sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. sábanas, frazadas y demás, para la posterior venta. Ella está muy agradecida a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, ya que D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda en su pequeña empresa.
texts.en:
The "Dulce Esperanza" ("Sweet Hope") committee was formed by the coming together of several friends and neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They came together with the objective of earning better incomes, and in this way to be able to help with their household finances.  The members have formed a group that is very united, and capable of together achieving things that strengthen their partnership.

Señora Maria is married and has no children.  She works selling all kinds of things such as cutlery, clothes, sheets, blankets, shoes and other items.  She works hard to support her nephews who were orphaned when they were very young.  She considers herself to be a very creative woman who is full of dreams.  She dreams that she will be able to have premises to offer her products.

She is asking for the loan to buy sheets, blankets and other items, for subsequent sale.  She is very grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that is being offered to her.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and cutlery.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  José Antonio  tiene cuarenta y nueve años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pan y pasteles  desde hace cinco años con su esposa  Rosario de  treinta y siete años de edad.
El señor José Antonio  le gusta mucho su negocio ya que su papa era panadero, su negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias ya que es muy reconocido en su ciudad pues sus pasteles son deliciosos.
El pidió el préstamo para  la compra de  insumos para la elaboración de pan como es manteca, harina, huevos, mantequilla, levadura etc.
Tienen la cantidad de cuatro hijos  dos mujeres Fabiola y Carmen y dos varones Gilberto y Antonio, por quienes trabaja cada día.
Uno de sus sueños es que su negocio  no  fracase que siga como  hasta ahora , con muchos clientes y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Le da  las gracias  a fundacion  realidad  por el apoyo  que le ha dado  para salir adelante  y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 49 years old.  He has been selling bread and cakes for the last five years with his wife, Rosario, 37.  José Antonio enjoys his work very much because his father was a baker.  His business produces good profits because it’s quite well known in his city because his cakes are delicious. He asked for the loan to buy bread baking ingredients like: shortening, flour, eggs, butter, yeast, etc.

They have four children:  two girls, Fabiola and Carmen and two boys, Gilberto and Antonio that he works hard for every day.  One of his dreams is that his business does not fail and continues as it’s done to date with lots of customers and that his children finish their schooling so that they will be able to have a better quality of life.  He thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it’s given him to get ahead and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Jose Luis   Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  José Luis  Antonio  tiene cuarenta y cuatro años de edad  se dedica a la venta de perfumes desde hace seis meses, con su esposa Claudia  que tiene  treinta  y ocho años de edad.
El señor José Luis  Antonio  le gusta mucho trabajar presta su servicio a un despacho contable  de auxiliar administrativo, después  de regresar de su trabajo se dedica a la venta de perfumes, ya que su esposa se encarga  de el negocio en las  mañanas cuando el se va a trabajar.
El pidió el préstamo para  la compara de perfumes por que luego se le terminan  y no tiene que  exhibir y sus  clientes desean ver productos nuevos.
Tiene dos hijos mayores de edad  quienes estudian   la lic. En  contabilidad.
Uno de sus  sueños es tener   una  tienda de perfumes  y farmacia  ya que le gustaría  vender ese tipo de artículos por que en su colonia no  hay ese tipo de tiendas.
Le da  las gracias  a fundacion  realidad  por el apoyo  que le ha dado  para salir adelante  y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
José Luis Antonio is 44 years old.  He’s been selling perfume for the last six months with his wife Claudia, 38.  José Luis Antonio enjoys working very much. He’s employed as an Administrative Assistant in an accounting office and when he gets home from work he sells perfume; his wife takes care of that business during the morning when he’s at work. He asked for the loan to buy perfume because he runs out and then doesn’t have any to display and his customers want new products.

He has two adult children who are studying Accounting.  One of his dreams is to have a perfume store and pharmacy because he’d like to sell his products in his own neighborhood because it lacks that type of store.  He thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it’s given him to get ahead and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Juana  Isabel  tiene  cincuenta y dos años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  desde hace  nueve años, con su esposo Pablo quien la apoya y le ayuda en todo.
La señora Juana  Isabel  le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que su tienda  la ha construido con esfuerzo y dedicación  tanto ella como su esposo y  sus hijos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar más mercancía ya que  ha decidido poner  una perfumería  y artículos de regalo.
Tiene  la cantidad de  dos hijos ya mayores de edad  que están felizmente casados  y con hijos.
Esta muy contenta ya que es abuela y sus nietos le van ayudar ha atender la tienda. 
Uno de sus  sueños es   hacer  mas grande su tienda y tener  mas productos y que siga igual con muchos clientes  y dejando  las mismas ganancias.
Le da  las gracias  a fundacion  realidad  por el apoyo  que le ha dado  para salir adelante  y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel is 52 years old.  She has been selling groceries for the last nine years with her husband, Pablo, who supports and helps her with everything.

Juana Isabel likes her work, which is the store, very much.  She has built up her store with effort and dedication both from herself and from her husband and children. She asked for the loan to buy more merchandise because she’s decided to add perfume and gift items.

She has two adult children who are happily married and have children of their own.  She is very happy because she’s a grandmother and her grandchildren come to help her in the store.

One of her dreams is to enlarge the store and to have more products and to continue with many customers to keep producing profits.  She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it’s given her to continue forward and reaching her goals.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Haja Sunna

texts.en:
Sunnah, age 56, is a rice vendor. She began her rice sales business because it was more profitable than her previous business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Sunnah earns about 1,000,000 LE a month. She and her husband have five grown children, ages 27, 30, 34, 37, and 40.
 
Sunnah requires a loan in order to buy more rice. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Sunnah plans to own a larger shop and build a dwelling house. She thanks you for your support.

.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CIELO AZUL.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosmery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de ropa, producción en comida, producción en textiles y servicio de cafe.

La señora Rosmery, indica que hace seis meses que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de café, que viene trabajando hace años atrás, implementando este negocio con el apoyo de su mamá.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azúcar y café) y arreglo de su kiosco, que comprara de la Av. Buenos Aires y lo comercializará en la Av. Chacaltaya. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, salud y la Asociación comunal.
texts.en:
The group "CIELO AZUL.” will begin a new cycle to benefit its women members.  This group has 6 members and is led by a head of council, Rosmery. The members' business sectors are diverse and include sales, production and services.  Rosmery has led "Pro Mujer" for the past 6 months, having been invited by friends to participate.  She runs a small café, a business that she has built up over several years assisted by her mother.
She seeks this credit to grow their base of capital (used to buy sugar and coffee) as well as to set up an improved kiosk for sales, that she will purchase on Avenue Buenos Aires and sell on Ave. Chacaltaya.  Her business allows her to support her family, as she is single and has 5 children.  She most enjoys "Pro Mujer" for its training, health and other programs offered.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee and set up a sales kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of liquor and foods such as bananas and cassava to resell.

loans.name: Santa Rita De Casia Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita D. Casia se denomina el excelente grupo D. mujeres conformado en la ciudad D. Ita, gracias a que la Señora Karina contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el segundo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
La señora Karina se dedica a la venta D. ropas, gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante, ya que le genera buenos ingresos. Comenta que tiene buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy lindas prendas a la venta. Sueña con poder tener una tienda donD. pueda exhibir sus productos, ya que D. esa forma atraerá más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. invierno, con lo que podrá abastecerse. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Santa Rita D. Casia is the name of an excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita thanks to Karina.  Karina contacted the advisor of the Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Women Entrepreneurs) during a weekly meeting in the area so that she could inform herself about the Comité's work.  Once Karina was advised about the program, she managed to bring together 15 women who now find themselves working together very comfortably and cooperatively in their second loan cycle.

Karina works in clothing sales.  Thanks to this job she has been able to get ahead, since it generates a good income for her.  She says that she has a good clientele because she always has very nice articles of clothing for sale.  She dreams of being able to have a store where she can show her merchandise, since that way she will attract more customers.

Karina is requesting a loan to buy winter clothes with which to supply herself.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity that this purchase will give her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, tiene la edad 42 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el engorde de pollos. Ella cuenta con varios pollos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para que su engorde sea más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con un buen peso para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de pollos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Lidia, 42, is married and lives with her husband and two children.  With the loan she intends to buy chicken feed to fatten her chickens.  She has several chickens and plans to give them feed so they will fatten more quickly.  She wants her animals to have a good weight for their later sale in the local market or other neighboring areas.  Lidia wants to generate the maximum profit for her well-being and that of her family, and to grow with the project of raising chickens.  This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously, she had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her chicken farm

loans.name: Osman Antonio

texts.es: Osman trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace mas de 20 años, desempeñandose como operador de maquinaria. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorando las condiciones de su casa, esta vez construyendo un muro que le ayudara a dar salida al agua en este tiempo de invierno. Sueña con poder darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida para vivir con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Osman has been working as a machinery operator for Juigalpa council for more than 20 years.  He is requesting his second loan so that he can continue improving his housing conditions, this time building a wall that will help provide an outlet for water during the winter season.  He dreams of being able to provide his family with better living conditions so that they can live peacefully.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 2 años, desempeñandose como ayudante de albañil. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de comprar un solar contiguo a la casa de su mamá, y asi independizarse y darle un lugar propio a su familia, pues actualmente habita en casa de sus padres y no quiere seguir asi, por eso quiere aprovechar la oportunidad de este credito para poco a poco ir teniendo su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Domingo has worked in the Juigalpa City Hall for the past two years as an assistant builder.  He now seeks his second credit to buy a small plot of land beside that of his mother, in order to give his family more independence in their own home.  He currently lives in his parents' house but wants to establish his own home with the help of this credit.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of land

loans.name: Abadatenguha (Murama-Nyamata) Group

texts.fr: Gentil est le client d.ACB, il est le membre du groupe Abadatenguha.Il  est  jeune marie, il a 33 ans, il vit avec son petit frère et il est dans son charge, il est Rwandais, il 6 ans des études primaire. C’est son première cycle de prêt avec ACB, et avec le prêt il va acheter des fertilisants (urée, NPK).la stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer les activités actuelle de l’agriculture de Tomates en augmentant la quantité des tomates pour satisfaire le marché. Pour son ambition il voudrait être un grand distributeur de tomates dans sa région, paye les frais des scolarités pour son petit frère  et paye le frais médicaux pour la famille.
texts.en: Gentil is a client of the microfinance institution ACB and a member of Abadatenguha Group. He is newly-wed, 33 years old and Rwandese. He lives with his younger brother who is under his care. He studied until sixth grade in elementary school. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy fertilizers (urea, nitrogen-phosphorous-potassium fertilizer). His growth strategy consists in improving his current tomato crops and harvesting more tomatoes to satisfy the demand from the market. His ambition is to become a great tomato seller in his area, pay the tuition fees for his young brother and pay for family healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea, nitrogen-phosphorous-potassium fertilizer).

loans.name: Santos Matias

texts.es: Santos trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 10 años, desempeñandose como vigilante. Esta solicitando  su 4To credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorando las condiciones de su casa, esta vez construyendo un cuarto para mejorar las condiciones de su familia, pues actualmente solo tiene uno y desea tener mayor privacidad.  Su mayor sueño es poder poco a poco ir mejorando su casita y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Santos works as a guard at the Juigalpa City Hall, a job he has held for the past 10 years.  He now seeks his fourth credit, in order to continue improving his housing.  He wishes to build another room in his house to better provide for his family, as currently it has only one room and the annex will provide more privacy.  His dream is to gradually improve his housing conditions and thus provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to construct a room in his house

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad 33 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y  una hija. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos para la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar una buena plantación para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de producción café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo, aged 33, is married and lives with his wife and one daughter.  With the loan, he is planning on buying supplies to help with his coffee plantation.  He has a coffee plantation, and plans to invest in supplies such as manure, labor, and fungicides in order to get a better harvest.  He wants to have in place a good plantation to sell quality coffee.  He wants to earn a greater quantity of earnings for his well-being and that of his family, and to grow with the goal of coffee production

This is his first loan that he has received through FODECOSUR.  He had not taken other loans previously from the state banks, but FODECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure, labor, and fungicides in order to get a better harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for sale and wood for crafting furniture.

loans.name: Ñustas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ÑUSTAS.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Flora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Flora, indica que hace once años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando cuando inicio la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comercialización de materiales escolares (librería y bazar), que viene trabajando hace diez años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de materiales educativos), que comprara de las tiendas que venden por mayor y lo comercializará en su librería. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The ÑUSTAS community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  The bank has seven members and is managed by a board of directors which is led by Flora.  The businesses that the members of this community bank are engaged in are varied and include commerce, production and services.

Flora says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for eleven years and joined when the institution started out.  She currently runs a business selling school supplies (stationery and miscellaneous goods).  She has been in this business for ten years.

Flora will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital (buying school supplies).  She will buy her supplies from wholesale stores and she will sell them in her stationery store.  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  Flora is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Flora replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La Señora Felicita tiene 40 años, está casada con Don Carlos hace mas D. 20 años, el cual trabaja como chofer D. una linea D. transporte hace 18 años, tienen dos hijos, el mayor es Juan D. 17 años y Juan Ramón D. 15 años.
La misma es comerciante hace mas D. 4 años, tiene una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio. Dice que tiene buena clientela ya que ella misma atienD. su negocio y le trata bien a la gente. Es muy conocida en el barrio y en las zonas aledañas. Además comenta que su marido la ayuda en su tiempo libre a atender en la despensa. Sueña, con poder agrandar su negocio, ya que D. esa forma podrá atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lactes, bebidas, panificados, carnes y demás para el abastecimiento D. su negocio. Está muy esperanzada con el crédito, ya que D. obtenerlo le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señora Felicita is 40 years old.  She has been married to Don Carlos for more than 20 years.  He has been working as a driver for a transportation company for 18 years.  They have two sons; the older is Juan, aged 17, and Juan Ramón is 15.

This same woman has been a retailer for more than four years; she has a well-stocked storeroom in her home.  She says that she has a good customer base whom she serves in her business, and she treats people well.  She is very well known in her neighborhood and in the neighboring areas.  She also comments that in her husband's free time, he helps her with the storeroom.  She dreams about expanding her business, as in this way she will be able attract more customers.

She is requesting the loan to buy diary products, drinks, bakery items, meat and other things for stocking her business.  She is very hopeful about the loan, as obtaining it is going to be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products and other items for stocking her storeroom.

loans.name: Welbin Jose

texts.es: Welbin de 27 años de edad trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 10 años, desempeñandose como auxiliar de bodega. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en la casa de su mamá para tener mejores condiciones y privacidad. Pues actualmente no cuenta con su propio espacio, y dado que su mamá le brinda la oportunidad de tenerlo quiere aprovechar.
texts.en:
Welbin, aged 27, has been working for the Juigalpa City Hall for 10 years, where he serves as an assistant in the storeroom. 

He is applying for his second loan, with the objective of building a room in his mother's house for better conditions and privacy.  Right now, he does not have his own space, and as his mother is offering him the opportunity to have this, he wants to take advantage of it.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: Carlos de 30 años de edad trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 4 años, desempeñandose como vigilante. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorandola casa en que vive junto a su familia, esta vez construyendo un cuarto que le permitira mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa e hijo, pues actualmente vive en casa de sus padres donde viven varias familias y desea tener su propio espacio para su propia familia.
texts.en: Carlos, 30, has worked at the City Hall of Juigalpa for four years, carrying out the duties of a security guard. He is seeking his third loan with the goal of continuing to improve the home where he lives with his family. This time he will build a room, which will allow him to improve the quality of life of his wife and son. Currently he lives in his parents' home, where several families reside, and he wishes to have his own space for his own family.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian, tiene la edad 28 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y  un hijo. El pretende con el crédito realizar el mantenimiento de su plantación de café. El cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un buen cafetal para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de producción café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cristian is 28 years old, is married and lives with his wife and son. He would like to use the loan for the upkeep of his coffee plantation. He owns a coffee plantation and would use the loan to pay for labour costs and to buy fertilizers and fungicides to improve his harvest. He wants to establish a good coffee plantation in order to sell a quality product. He wants to maximise his profits for the benefit of him and his family and to expand his coffee production business. This is his first loan with FUNDECOSUR. He has never taken a loan from any state bank. However, FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with the very good terms and conditions and at a very low rate of interest.

loans.use: to improve his coffee plantation.

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es: German trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 13 años, desempeñandose como  policia municipal. Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de levantar las paredes de concreto de su casa, pues actualmente es de madera y quiere irla haciendo poquito por poquito.  Sueña con poder seguir mejorado su casa y  las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
German has worked for the City Hall in Juigalpa for 13 years, carrying out the duties of a city police office. He is seeking his sixth loan for the purpose of putting up some concrete walls in his home. Currently the walls are made of wood, and he wants to go about fixing it up little by little. 

He dreams of being able to continue making improvements to his home and to his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to raise some walls.

loans.name: Gloria Amada

texts.es:
loria tiene 57 años vive en Pujilí cerca de Latacunga Centro sur de Ecuador, vive con sus tres hijos que tienen 33, 29 y 16 años, Gloria se describe como una persona tranquila y responsable.

Trabaja en la crianza de animales los cuales son cuyes, cerdos, becerros, trabaja acompañada de sus hijos. Ya a trabajado con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y becerros para seguir incrementando sus animales y seguir en la crianza de los mismos.

El crédito le ayudará a seguir creciendo con su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos económicos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and lives in Pujilí near Latacunga in south central Ecuador. She lives with her three children who are 33, 29 and 16 years old. Gloria describes herself as an easygoing and responsible person. 

She works raising animals including guinea pigs, swine, and calves. She works in the company of her children. She has worked previously with FODEMI, and the loan she seeks is for purchasing pigs and calves so that she may continue to expand her herds and keep caring for them. 

The loan will help her continue to grow with her business and raise her income, and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and calves.

loans.name: Virgen De Candelaria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIRGEN DE CANDELARIA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Catalina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de salchipapas, venta de artesanías, panadería, venta de comida, venta de boletos, tienda de barrio.

La señora Catalina, indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación del asesor y promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de aceite y conservas), que comprara de la distribuidora de Copacabana misma y lo comercializará en su establecimiento. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la amistad de las socias.
texts.en:
The “VIRGEN DE CANDELARIA” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office.  The group has ten members and is managed by a board of directors which is led by Catalina.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include selling 'salchipapas' (traditional fast food), selling handicrafts, running a bakery, selling food, selling tickets and running a neighborhood store.

Catalina says that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer and promotional work.  She currently runs a neighborhood store where she has been working for five years.

Catalina will use this loan to increase her capital (buying oil and canned goods).  She will buy her goods from a supplier in Copacabana and sell them in her establishment.  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  Catalina is single and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Catalina replied that she likes the friendship of her fellow community bank members.

loans.use: to buy oil and canned goods

loans.name: Abakundumurimo (Mrm) Group

texts.fr: Félicien est le client d.ACB, il est le membre du groupe Abakundumurimo .Il  est  célibataire, il a 30 ans, il vit avec son petit frère et il est dans son charge, il est Rwandais, il  a 6 ans des études secondaire. C’est son première cycle de prêt avec ACB, et avec le prêt il va acheter des fertilisants (urée, NPK) pour les champs des tomates.la stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer les activités actuelle de l’agriculture de tomates en augmentant la quantité des tomates pour satisfaire le marché. Pour son ambition il voudrait être un grand distributeur de tomates dans sa région, paye les frais des scolarités pour son petit frère  et prépare l’avenir pour sa famille.
texts.en: Félicien is a client of the microfinance institution ACB and a member of Abakundumurimo Group. He is single, 30 years old and Rwandese. He lives with his younger brother who is under his care. He studied until sixth grade in secondary school. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy fertilizers (urea, nitrogen-phosphorous-potassium fertilizer) for his tomato fields. His growth strategy consists in improving his current tomato crops and harvesting more tomatoes to satisfy the demand from the market. His ambition is to become a great tomato seller in his area, pay the tuition fees for his young brother and secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea, nitrogen-phosphorous-potassium fertilizer) for his tomato fields.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleny, tiene la edad de 33 años, está en unión libre  y vive con su conyugue y seis hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito invertir en la compra de concentrado para el engorde de Pollos. Ella cuenta con una pollera a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para engordarlos más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con un mejor peso para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de Pollos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yorleny, who is 33 years old, lives with her common-law husband and six children. She hopes to use the loan to invest in the purchase of concentrated feed for broiler chickens. She has a chicken coop, and what she wants is to feed the chickens concentrated feed so that they fatten up faster. She wants her animals to weigh more when she sells them later in her town’s market or in neighboring communities. She wants to maximize her profits for her well-being and that of her family, and also to help grow her chicken-raising project. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better repayment options and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To raise poultry

loans.name: Santiago Apostol Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado  por diez  mujeres  indígenas  que se dedican  a diferentes  actividades  económicas , ellas  formaron el grupo  ya que son vecinas  de  la comunidad .
Este grupo se llama Santiago  Aposto  pues sus clientes son muy devotos al santito de santiago apostol.
La representante de este grupo es la   señora  Silvina  de treinta y siete años de edad  esta felizmente casada  con el señor  Perfecto  ambos tienen cuatro hijos que estudian.
La señora Silvia fue quien enviíto a las persona a formar parte de  este grupo; ella se dedica a la venta de pan , es muy reconocida  en su localidad  ya que hace unos panes  muy deliciosos  ya que ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace veinte años , siempre tiene muy buenas ventas  además de que vende el pan en su localidad  sale a venderlos fuera para que las personas prueben el delicioso pan de  de Jicayan.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para  comprar  más insumos para la elaboración   del pan:
Manteca, harina, panela entre otros para que se le facilite y realice  más y tenga  un poco mas de ganancias; ya que estas las utiliza  para que sus hijos puedan segur estudiando , de igual manera  para realizar sus pagos que adquirido del préstamo.
Las mujeres que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Soledad –se dedica a la venta de pan.
Maria –se dedica a la venta de  trajes bordados.
Emilia –se dedica a la venta de ropa elaborada  a mano.
Juana – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Irene – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Consuelo – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Deysi- se dedica a la venta de artículos de fantasía.
Eva – se dedica a la venta de  zapatos.
Macedonia- se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que las ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de este milagro par tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is made up of ten indigenous women who work in different business activities.  They formed this group as they are neighbors from the same community.

This group is called 'Santiago Apostol' as its members are devout followers of the saint of Santiago Apostol.  The group's representative is Silvia.  She is 37 years old and happily married to Perfecto.  The couple have four children who are all in school.  It was Silvia who invited people to join this group.  Her business is selling bread and she is very well known in her town as she makes delicious bread.  She has been in this business for twenty years and always has very good sales.  In addition to selling bread in her town, she also sells her bread elsewhere so that people are able to taste delicious Jicayan bread.

Silvia requested this loan to buy more supplies for making bread (butter, flour, unrefined sugar, etc.) so that she can produce more and make more profits which she uses so that her children can continue studying and she can continue repaying her loan.

The women who make up this group are:
Soledad - who sells bread.
Maria - who sells embroidered dresses.
Emilia - who sells hand-made clothes.
Juana - who sells Mexican snacks.
Irene - who sells Mexican snacks.
Consuelo - who sells Mexican snacks.
Deysi - who sells costume jewelry.
Eva - who sells shoes.
Macedonia - who sells groceries.

The women thank Fundacion Realidad for the support that they have provided to enable them to get ahead in life and fulfill their dreams, and for being part of this miracle so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell bread

loans.name: Serafin

texts.es: Serafin, tiene la edad 45 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos. El pretende con el crédito invertir en la compra de concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. El cuenta con varios cerdos y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para lograr un engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el mejor peso para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Serafín, 45, is married living with his wife and three children.  He intends to use the loan to buy concentrate to fatten up his pigs.  He has several pigs and he intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly.  He wants his animals to be at better weight to the sell them at his local market or in surrounding areas.  He wants to earn the most profit possible for his and his family’s wellbeing and to grow with the pig raising project.  This is his first FUDECUSUR loan.  He has had no previous loans from state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for his pigs.

loans.name: Reiner

texts.es: Reiner, tiene la edad 36 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y una hija. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de almacigo de café. El cuenta con una plantación de almacigo de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener un mejor almacigo. El quiere obtener una buena plantación  para vender un almacigo de café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de siembra y venta de almacigo de café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Reiner, aged 36, is married and lives with his wife and one daughter.

With the loan he plans to help his coffee plantation.  He has a coffee plantation, and plans to invest in supplies such as manure, labor and fungicides in order to get a better plantation.  He wants to have a good plantation to sell quality coffee.  He wants to generate a greatear amount of earnings for his well-being and that of his family.

This is his first loan that he has received through FODECOSUR.  He had not taken other loans previously from the state banks, but FODECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: supplies such as manure, labor and fungicides in order to get a better plantation.

loans.name: Las Vecinitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Vecinitas, está conformado por la señora Yuridia va a comprar con su préstamo materia prima platos desechables, vasos, cuchara, tenedores, popotes, la señora Luz María va a comprar cera por kilo y veladoras por caja, la señora Isabel va a comprar frutas, plátanos, manzanas, verduras, chiles secos , pollo para vender por kilo o por pieza, la señora Irma va a comprar mesas y tablones, la señora Maricela va a comprar, manteles de plástico, gas, platos desechables, vasos, cucharas, jitomates. La señora Isabel tiene 62 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria, ella  es divorciada tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad ya todos casados, ella tiene su negocio de venta de frutas, verduras, chiles secos, pollo por kilo o por pieza, mole rojo y verde, ella solicito su préstamo para surtir su negocio va a comprar verduras, chiles secos, frutas, pollo, legumbres, plátanos, manzanas, naranjas, jitomate, tomate, papas, chiles, calabaza y los insumos para preparar el mole rojo y el mole de pipián o (verde). Ella inicio su negocio hace 30 años por necesidad y por falta de recursos económicos, inicio con poco con lo que le daba su esposo para el gasto y fue creciendo poco a poco, su negocio es importante porque se va ayudando para pagar el préstamo, para la comida, ella se siente orgullosa de saber preparar el mole que su suegra le enseño a elaborar y ahora ella lo prepara con mucho amor y esmero para sus clientas que son las señoras ama de casa, este negocio le ha ayudado mucho cuando su niños estaban chicos y pudo sacarlos adelante, su negocio es popular por el sabor del mole, por la forma que atiente a sus clientes con atención y respeto. Los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son costo elevados en los ingredientes del mole. Sus sueños y esperanzas son hacer unos cuartos para recamaras y lo mejor para sus hijos que no le falte nada y estén contentos con sus familias. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por su ayuda y que nos sigan incrementando el monto de los préstamos para crecer los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Las Vecinitas'.  It was formed by Yuridia who will use her loan to buy materials such as disposable plates, cups, spoons, forks and straws.  Luz Maria will buy wax by the kilo and candles by the box.  Isabel will buy fruit, bananas, apples, vegetables, dried chilis, chicken by the kilo and chicken by the piece.  Irma will buy tables and boards.  Maricela will buy plastic tablecloths, gas, disposable plates, cups, spoons and tomatoes.

Isabel is 62 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is divorced and has five grown-up children who are all married.  She has a business selling fruit, vegetables, dried chilis, chicken by the kilo or by the piece, and green and red 'mole' sauce.  She requested this loan to stock her business.  She will buy vegetables, dried chilis, fruit, chicken, bananas, apples, oranges, tomatoes, potatoes, chilis, pumpkins and the supplies she needs to make red and green 'mole' sauce (the latter is made from 'pipian' squash).  She started her business 30 years ago through necessity and owing to a lack of financial resources.  She started out with just a little money and helped her husband to cover their expenses.  She gradually grew her business.  Isabel's business is important because it helps her to repay her loan and cover her food costs.  She feels proud to know how to prepare the 'mole' sauce that her mother-in-law taught her how to make and she now prepares it with a lot of love and care for her customers who are housewives.  This business helped her a lot when her children were young and she was able to get them ahead in life.  Her business is popular owing to the flavor of her 'mole' sauce and because of the way in which she serves her customers with care and respect.  The challenges that she faces in her business are the high costs of her 'mole' ingredients.  Her dreams and hopes are to build some bedrooms and provide her children with the best in life so that they do not want for anything and so that they and their families are happy.  The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad "Thank you for your help and we hope that you will continue increasing the size of our loans so that we are able to grow our businesses and families".

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dried chilis, fruit, chicken, bananas, apples, oranges, tomatoes, potatoes, chilis and pumpkins

loans.name: El Cedral Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Cedral está conformado por la señora Irma va a comprar con su préstamo pan, la señora Lucia va a comprar una máquina para rasurar, gama de tintes, secadora y cepillos, la señora Adriana Berenice va a comprar de paquetes de cosméticos  de Jafra y Mary Kay, la señora Mónica va a comprar aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, focos, huevo, jabón, café, refrescos para surtir su tienda, la señora Bertha va a comprar puercos lechones y alimento para engordarlos y venderlos. La señora Lucia tiene 29 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella es casada, su esposo trabaja en el campo y cuando no hay trabajo en el campo, trabaja como ayudante de albañil, ellos no tienen hijos, ella tiene una estética, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar una máquina para cortar el cabello, una secadora,  una plancha y algunos líquidos y tintes para el cabello, ella inicio su negocio hace un año, aprendió en un curso que tomo en una localidad vecina de parte del ayuntamiento, inicio con pocas cosas con sus ahorros de las ventas de tlacoyos (mexican snack), ella del diario sale a vender sus tlacoyos de aba, requesón y frijol en el centro de la comunidad donde ella vive, su negocio es importante porque le gusta lo que hace y le genera ingresos, ella se siente orgullosa cuando pinta el cabello, hace chinos o peinados y a la gente le gusta como le queda, sus clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar todos los insumos, mobiliario y materiales necesario para trabajar para proporcionar a sus clientes mayores comodidades y los servicios que soliciten, ella lo piensa lograr esforzándose, ahorrando y con el préstamo va a surtirse de todos los materiales. Las ganancias las utiliza en gastos para la casa y para volver a invertir, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque  va a adquirir algunos productos de los que necesita su estética. Los integrantes del grupo quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos muy agradecidas con ustedes y felices de que nos puedan ayudar, ojala sigan ayudando a más personas  con sus préstamos podemos crecer los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called El Cedral. Of its members, Señora Irma is going to buy bread with her loan; Señora Lucia is going to buy an electric razor, a set of dyes, a dryer, and brushes; Señora Adriana Berenice is going to buy packages of Jafra and Mary Kay cosmetics; Señora Monica is going to buy oil, sugar, toilet paper, light bulbs, eggs, soap, coffee, and soft drinks to stock her store; Señora Bertha is going to buy suckling pigs, fatten them and sell them.

Señora Lucia is 29 years old. She attended school up to the third year of secondary school. She is married. Her husband works in the fields, and when there is no work in the fields, he works as an assistant to a bricklayer. They do not have children. She has a beauty salon. She is applying for the loan to buy electric clippers for haircutting, a dryer, an iron, and various liquids and dyes for hair. She began her business a year ago. She learned in a course from the municipality that she took nearby. She began with a few things with her savings from selling tlacoyos (a Mexican snack). Every day she went out to sell her tlacoyos of fava beans, cheese curds, and kidney beans in the center of the community where she lives. Her business is important because she likes what she does and it generates income for her. She feels proud when she dyes hair, curls it, or does hairdos and the customer likes the result. Her clients are relatives, friends, and neighbors from the community. She is planning to expand her business and to buy all the supplies, furniture and materials necessary for her work, to give her customers better comfort and the services that they request. She thinks she will succeed by making an effort and saving, and with the loan she is going to stock up on all the materials. She will use the earnings for household expenses and to reinvest in her business. She is happy to be receiving the loan because she is going to acquire some products that she needs in her salon.

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad, "We are very grateful to you and happy that you can help us. May you continue helping more people. With your loans we can grow our businesses and our families."

loans.use: to buy electric clippers for cutting hair, a dryer, an iron, and liquids and dyes for hair.

loans.name: El Durazno Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Durazno, está conformado por la señora Libia va a comprar con su préstamo Nuez, las señoras Florinda, Araceli y Rosa van a compra hilo de lana para elaborar rebozos, gabanes, morrales, bufandas, la señora Domitila va a comprar fertilizante, abono para sus árboles de aguacate, limones, chayotes y frambuesa, la señora Enriqueta va a comprar cajas y papel para empacar aguacate, peras, membrillo, durazno e higos. La señora Florinda tiene 48 años de edad ella estudio hasta el 4º. Año de primaria, ella es casada tiene 9 hijos, 6 mayores de edad ya trabajan y 3 menores de edad que están estudiando 2 en la secundaria y uno en la primaria, ella elabora artesanías en telar de cintura como gabanes, rebozos, bufandas, morrales, mañanitas, bolsas, tapetes, cobijas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilo de lana para surtirse de la materia prima, ella pertenece al grupo de gabaneros de Hueyapan desde hace 17 años, ella aprendió desde muy pequeña su mama y su abuelita le enseñaron a trabajar en telar de cintura, ella sale a vender  sus productos en las ferias con los turistas y visitantes, su  negocio es importante porque le gusta trabajar en este negocio y le deja ganancias, ella reparte las ganancias una parte para volver a invertir en material, otra parte para comprar utensilios para la cocina y para la comida,  ella se siente orgullosa de ser indígena y de participar en eventos cívicos y ser la primera en recibir y saludar al gobernador  se viste con su traje regional, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir la va a utilizar para comprar hilo para seguir trabajando, sus sueños y esperanzas son ver a su hijos casados y los más pequeños que están estudiando que tengan una carrera. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por creer en nosotros y no le vamos a quedar mal, para que nos vuelvan a prestar y seguir adelante en nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
This supportive group called El Durazno is made up of Libia, who is going to use her loan to buy walnuts; Florinda, Araceli and Rosa, who will buy wool yarn to make shawls, overcoats, bags and scarves; Domitila, who will buy fertilizer and manure for her avocados, limes, squash and raspberries; and Enriqueta, who will buy boxes and paper to pack avocados, pears, quince, peaches and figs. 

Florinda, 48, studied until the 4th grade. She is married and has 9 children, 6 of whom are grown and working and 3 who are still in school - 2 in high school and 1 in elementary school. She makes artisan goods on a back strap loom like overcoats, shawls, scarves, bags, robes, carpets and blankets. She asked for this loan to buy wool yarn to stock up on prime materials. She has been part of a group of weavers from Hueyapan for 17 years. From a very young age from her mother and grandmother taught her to use the back strap loom. She goes out to sell her products in the street fairs with tourists and visitors. Her business is important because she likes doing it and it brings in profits. She reinvests part of the profits in materials, and the other part is used to buy cooking utensils and food. She is proud of being indigenous and participating in civic events and being the first to greet the governor on his visit, wearing her traditional clothing. 

She is happy about the loan that she will receive, which she will use to buy thread to keep working. Her hopes and dreams are to see her children married and that the youngest who are still in school become professionals. The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad: "we thank you for believing in us and we will not let you down, so that you will lend to us again and we can move forward with our businesses."

loans.use: to buy wool thread to make overcoats, shawls, scarves, robes, bags, rugs and blankets.

loans.name: Las Comadres Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Comadres, está conformado por la señora Salustia Dorotea va a comprar pollo y alimento para engordar los pollos, la señora Blanca Estela va a comprar huevo, aceite, azúcar, refrescos etc., la señora Candelaria va a comprar cajas de aguacate, la señorita María del Carmen va a comprar crema, queso, verduras, carnes y refrescos, La señora Blanca Estela tiene 50 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 4º. semestre del CBTA, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo que es campesino, ellos tienen dos hijos mayores de edad ya trabajan y son casados, ella tiene su negocio de venta de tacos dorados y una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su crédito para comprar gas y manteca para elaborar los tacos dorados y azúcar, aceite, huevo, jabón, papel higiénico, refrescos etc. para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años por falta de recursos económicos, su esposo la motivo, el le enseño este negocio y con sus propios ingresos de lo que ganaban en su trabajo compraron los insumos y los utensilios para elaborar los tacos dorados, ella sale a vender sus productos los sábados  y entre semana atiende los pedidos, ella ofrece a sus clientes tacos dorados de papa, requesón y de carne de res o puerco, su negocio es importante porque tiene una fuente de ingresos para la familia, ella está contenta con su negocio, porque gracias a su negocio comen bien toda la familia sale a vender los tacos y ya tiene para comprar para la comida, ella se siente orgullosa cuando sus clientes le dicen que sus tacos están sabrosos, la competencia que enfrenta su negocio es que muchas señoras le copian pero venden un tiempo y dejan de vender, ella está planeando poner un local en el mercado donde venda los tacos dorados, ella tiene la esperanza de ponerle colado y loseta a su casa y que vivan bien toda la familia. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamo que nos sacan de apuros y de los compromisos, gracias a ustedes, podemos progresar siempre y cuando el dinero se utilice para algo productivo”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called "Las Comadres".  Salustia Dorotea is going to buy chicken, and  feed to fatten chickens.  Blanca Estella  is going to buy eggs, cooking oil, sugar, soft drinks etc. Candelaria is going to buy crates of avocados. María del Carmen is going to buy cream, cheese, vegetables, meats and soft drinks. 

Blanca Estela is 50, and went to school as far as 4th semester of vocational high school.  She lives in a common-law relationship with her husband, who is a farmer. They have two adult children who are already working and married.  She has a business selling fried tacos, and a grocery store.  She is applying for a loan to buy gas and lard to make fried tacos, as well as sugar, cooking oil, eggs, soap, toilet paper, soft drinks etc. to stock her grocery store.  

She started her business 5 years ago because she needed financial resources. Her husband encouraged her, and taught her this business.  With the income that they earned from their work, they bought ingredients and utensils for making fried tacos. She goes out to sell her products on Saturdays, and during the week she fills orders. She offers her customers fried tacos made with potatoes, requesón (similar to cottage or ricotta cheese), beef, or pork. 

Her business is important as a source of family income. She's happy with her business, because thanks to it, the whole family eats well. She goes out and sells her tacos, and then has the money to buy food.  She feels proud when her clients tell her that her tacos are delicious.  The competition her business faces is that many ladies copy her, but only sell for a time and then stop. She is is planning to set up a location in the market to sell fried tacos. Her hope is to put a cement and tile floor in her house, and that all her family live well.   

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you very much for your loans that get us out of difficulties and tight spots.   Thanks to you, we can get ahead as long as the money is used for something productive.

loans.use: To buy gas, lard, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, soap, toilet paper, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: El Rincon Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Rincón, está conformado por la señora Juana va a comprar con su crédito perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, Topperware y ropa, la señora Barbará va a comprar pollos, maíz y alimento para engordar los pollos, el señor Miguel va a comprar forraje y alimento para engordar sus becerros, la señora María Petra va a comprar botellas con agua, refrescos, jugos, crema, azúcar, carnes frías, la señora Socorro va a comprar aguacate, durazno, manzana, peras todo por caja, la señora María Elena va a comprar una parrilla, maíz, verduras, lácteos para elaborar la comida. La señora María Petra tiene 33 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella es mama soltera tiene 2 hijos varones de 12 y 13 años de edad ellos están estudiando la secundaria, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida  sopa aguada, guisados, dobladas, tacos de arroz, tortas, pozole y tamales, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar botellas de agua, refrescos, verduras, carnes frías, aceite, arroz y carnes, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años a petición de los clientes ya que es un lugar muy concurrido a lado de su casa está un curandero donde llegan  muchas personas a consultas, ella inicio con un préstamo que le dieron, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para la comida y para los gastos de sus hijos de la escuela , a ella le gusta cocinar, tener buena atención y amabilidad con sus clientes para que regresen a consumir sus productos, ella se siente orgullosa de salir adelante ella sola con sus hijos, su negocio es popular por el sazón de la comida, las dobladitas y las picaditas, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio ponerle  techo al local y mesas pequeñas para que se este mas bonito y lo piensa lograr con el préstamo que le van a proporcionar, sus sueños y esperanzas  son estar bien de salud, poner el techo al local y que crezca su negocio. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad, “gracias por darnos la oportunidad de crecer más nuestros negocios y tener mejores oportunidades de vivir mejor con la familia, gracias”. El señor de playera anaranjada y cabello blanco no es integrante del grupo.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called El Rincón ["the corner"] and is made up of Juana, who will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, Topperware, and clothing; Barbará, who will buy chickens, corn, and chicken feed; Miguel, who will buy fodder for his calves; María Petra, who will buy bottled water, soft drinks, juices, cream, sugar, and cold cuts; Socorro, who will buy boxes of fruits such as avocados, nectarines, apples, and pears; and María Elena, who will buy a grill, corn, vegetables, and dairy products to make food. 

María Petra is 33 years old and stayed in school through her 3rd year of middle school. She is a single mother or 2 boys, ages 12 and 13, who both attend middle school. She  owns a food counter, selling soups, stews, dobladas, rice tacos, tortas, pozole,and tamales. She is requesting this loan to buy  bottled water, soft drinks, vegetables, meats, oil, and rice. She started her business 3 years ago in response to popular demand from her customers, as the area alongside her house was already highly-trafficked due to the presence of a spiritual healer where many people go for consultations. She started with a loan that her customers gave her and her business is important because it generates income that goes to the food and school expenses of her boys. 

She enjoys cooking, is efficient and friendly with her customers so that they will want to come back again for more. She feels proud for getting ahead as a single mother and that her business is popular for the flavorful food, dobladitas and picaditas. She is planning to expand her business by putting up a roof and adding small tables so that it will be a more pleasant place and thinks she manage to do so with her portion of this loan. Her hopes and dreams are to stay in good health, put a roof over her locale and grow her business. 

The group members would like to relay the following to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad [Kiva field partner]: "Thank you for giving us the opportunity to keep growing our businesses and have better opportunities to improve our families' lives. Thank you."

loans.use: to buy  bottled water, soft drinks, vegetables, meats, oil, rice, and meat to make food for sale.

loans.name: Rosita Diaz Group

texts.es:
