La A.C. “ROSITRA DIAZ” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carnicería, tejido de chompas, mantas de seda, venta de verduras, venta de jugos, venta de zapatos

La señora Rosa  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne que viene trabajando hace once años atrás por intermedio de sus Tíos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de máquina de cortar carne que comprará de la Ceja y posterior a lo adecuará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación.
texts.en:
The Rosita Diaz Group took out its first loan with ProMujer [Kiva field partner], as part of the Senkata Center. The group is made up of 9 members and is lead by an executive council headed by Rosa. The group members own and operate businesses in a variety of areas: such as butchery, weaving sweaters, sowing silk gloves, selling produce and juices, and selling shoes.    

Rosa states that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, having signed up by the invitation of a representative. Currently, she runs a business selling meats that she came to work for eleven years ago through a family connection.

This loan is for buying a meat slicer, which she plans to buy from the Ceja shopping district and install in her store. This means of work allows her to earn income to support her family in as much as she can, as she is married and has a son. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she appreciated the training.

loans.use: to buy a meat slicer for her business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con la ayuda de ellos ha podido salir adelante y mantener a su familia. A sus 53 años ha tenido una gran experiencia en su actividad, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo por lo que tiene que proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios para sobrevivir. el crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de golosinas, grano básicos, refrescos pan y detergentes.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora’s business is a general store. She has had this business for more than 8 years. This is not the first time she has received funding. With financing she has been able to get by and support her family. At age 53 she has had a great experience with her business.  She has one dependent child for whom she has to earn needed income to survive. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase sweets, bulk grains, beverages, bread and detergent.

loans.use: to buy sweets, bulk grains, beverages, bread and detergent.

loans.name: Dora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Dora, es originaria de la ciudad de León, esta casada, es madre de 4 hijos. Ella estudio contabilidad pero es dueña de una pulpería. Ella inicio su actividad de comercio hace 25 años cuando puso la pulpería este ha sido su segundo negocio. Anteriormente tenia un puesto de sodas donde distribuía al por mayor y al detalle el negocio lo administraba su esposa mientras ella trabajaba en una empresa agrícola ella se desempañada en el área de contabilidad pero la despidieron y con el pago de su liquidación puso su negocio de pulpería en la que actualmente vende productos varios tales como granos básicos, sodas, leche, huevo, verduras, jugos enlatados.  
Requiere el préstamo para comprar pollo y carnes al por mayor. Ya que estos productos son muy demandados por su clientes y generan buena ganancia. En sus planes futuros ella quiere comprar un vehículo para entregar productos comestible que ella vende a domicilio con esto daría mas rotación a su inventario. Posteriormente le gustaría convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
Dora, a native of León, is married and the mother of 4 children.  She studied accounting but is the owner of a general store. She started this business 25 years ago when she established the store beside her second business.  Previously she had a soda stand where she sold wholesale and her husband ran the business and handled the finances while she worked for an agricultural company.  She worked in the accounting department but they let her go.  She used the severance pay to open the general store where she currently sells various products such as basic grains, milk, eggs, vegetables and canned juices.

She needs the loan to buy chicken and meat wholesale since these products have a big demand from her customers and generate good earnings.  In her future plans she wants to buy a vehicle to deliver her products, fuel that she will sell to homes, and these will give her more inventory rotation.  Later she would like to convert her general store into a food distribution center.

loans.use: To buy chicken and meat wholesale.

loans.name: Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JOYITAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de enaguas a máquina, chofer, tejido de mantas, tienda, panadería, limpieza

La señora Juana,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora de zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tejido de enaguas en máquina que viene trabajando recientemente, aprendiendo este oficio de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra lana, hilos y botones) que adquirirá por mayor y los trabajará en su casa. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que todos los pagos son rápidos.
texts.en:
The “Joyitas” communal bank will begin its second loan cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional hub. It is made up of 9 members and is managed by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Juana.  The businesses carried out by members of the communal bank are varied and include: machine knitted skirts, a chauffeur, woven blankets, a general store, a bakery and a cleaning service.

Sra. Juan states that she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year and that she joined the organization by invitation from a supporter in the area. Currently she has a business that she started running recently selling machine knitted skirts, a craft she learned from her mother. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (to buy wool, thread and buttons wholesale) and she will work at home. This kind of work will enable her to generate income to support her family since she is a single mother and has two children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the fact that all of the disbursements are prompt.

loans.use: to buy multi-colored wool, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Francisca está levantando la mano). 

La señora Francisca, tiene 30 años de edad, nació en la provincia de Paruro (Cusco) y ahora vive en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa distrito de Anta de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace 22 años en la comunidad y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Francisca se dedica a la elaboración de bloquetas (Un bloque es un mampuesto prefabricado, elaborado con hormigones finos o morteros de cemento, utilizado en la construcción de muros y paredes.) . También, Fransisca se dedica la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo piedra chancada, bolsas de cemento, confitillo y arena fina. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo bolsas de cementos (Una bolsa cemento cuesta aproximadamente s/. 23.00 nuevos soles).  Francisca en algunas ocasiones compra bolsas de cemento por mayor en la ciudad del Cusco pues le resulta más barato y en otras veces compra unas cuantas bolsas de cemento de tiendas de la zona para no quedarse sin materiales de trabajo. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta” son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa en la casa de unas de las socias. El Banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa y sus actividades económicas de los demás socios son por ejemplo venta de comida, venta de granos, venta de cosméticos, venta de carne, crianza de animales menores, venta de verduras y venta de hierba medicinales.   La comunidad de Hospitalpampa se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos en carro de la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América".
texts.en:
(In the photograph, the group member Francisca is raising her hand.) Señora Francisca, who is 30 years old, was born in the province of Paruro (Cusco) and now lives in the community of Hospitalpampa in the Anta district in Anta province of the department of Cusco. Twenty-two years ago she settled in the community where she now carries out her business activities.

Francisca makes blocks. (A block is a prefabricated unit, made with fine cement or mortar, used in the construction of walls.) She also sells construction materials, such as crushed stone, gravel, and fine sand. She has already been in this business for six years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. At this time Francisca needs a loan to buy more materials, such as bags of cement. (A bag of cement costs about 23 PEN.) Francisca sometimes buys bags of cement wholesale in the city of Cusco, which is cheaper for her, and at other times she buys a few bags of cement in shops in her district so that she won't be without working materials.

The meetings of the members of the communal bank "Virgen Asunta" are held every month in the community of Hospitalpampa in the home of one of the members. The communal bank is made up of people who are workers and entrepreneurs and who are always looking for opportunities to advance and, with their daily effort, give their children a better future. The majority of the members live in the community of Hospitalpampa, and the businesses of the other members include, for example, food sales, grain sales, cosmetic sales, meat sales, raising small animals, selling vegetables, and selling herbal medicines. 

The community of Hospitalpampa is located 45 minutes by car from the city of Cusco. Cusco has been known for many years as the "Archaeological Capital of America."

loans.use: to buy more building materials, for example, bags of cement

loans.name: Los Tres Barrios - Qoricancha Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, tiene 31 años D. edad, nació en la provincia D. Anta del distrito D. Cachimayo (Cusco) y ahora vive en la comunidad D. CCoricancha distrito D. Chinchero D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace varios años en la comunidad y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Isabel está casada con el señor Cesar y fruto D. esta unión tiene dos hijos, ellos se esfuerzan para sacar adelante a sus hijos pues ellos se dedican a la artesanía, agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y otras cosas más que se necesitan para el sembrado D. papas y maíz. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Los Tres Barrios - CCoricancha” son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. CCoricancha en la casa D. unas D. las socias. El Banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. CCoricancha y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. comida, crianza D. animales menores, venta D.  granos, venta D. tubérculos, venta D. carne, elaboración D. artesanía. La comunidad D. CCoricancha se encuentra ubicada a una hora y treinta minutos en carro D. la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es conocido desD. hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica D. América".
texts.en:
Señora Isabel, who is 31 years old, was born in the province of Anta in the Cachimayo (Cusco) district, and she now lives in the community of Qoricancha in the Chinchero district of the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. She settled in this community some years ago, and this is where she carries out her business activity.

Isabel is married to Señor Cesar, and they have two children. They strive to raise their children, working in handicrafts, agriculture, and raising livestock. They have worked in these areas for several years, and things are going well for them, thanks to the effort that they put into their work. At this time Isabel needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other additional items that are needed for the planting of potatoes and corn.

The meetings of the members of the communal bank "Los Tres Barrios -- Qoricancha" (The Three Neighborhoods -- Qoricancha) are held every month in the community fo Qoricancha in the home of one of the members. The communal bank consists of people who are workers and entrepreneurs who are always looking for opportunities to advance and, through their daily effort, to give a better future to their children. The majority of the members live in the community of Qoricancha, and the businesses of the other members are, for example, food sales, raising small animals, selling grains, selling root vegetables, selling meat, and making handicrafts. The community of Qoricancha is located about and hour and a half by car from the city of Cusco. Cusco has been known for many years as the "Archaeological Capital of the Americas."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Virgen De Natividad De Chuso Group

texts.es:
La señora Elena, tiene 44 años D. edad, nació en la provincia D. Anta del distrito D. Cachimayo (Cusco) y ahora vive en la comunidad D. Chuso distrito D. Chinchero D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace varios años en la comunidad y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Elena está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella se esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos pues ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, ovejas, cuyes, gallinas y para tierras D. cultivo comprara abono, fertilizantes y semillas.   

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Natividad D. Chuso” son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Chuso en la casa D. unas D. las socias. El Banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Chuso y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. comida, crianza D. animales menores, venta D.  granos, venta D. tubérculos, venta D. carne, elaboración D. artesanía. La comunidad D. Chuso se encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos en carro D. la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es conocido desD. hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica D. América".
texts.en:
Mrs Elena is 44 years old, was born in the Cachimayo district, in the province of Anta (Cusco) and now lives in Chuso, in the Chincherro district, in the province of Urubamba, Cusco. She has been living and doing business here for several years.

Elena is married and has 5 children. She works hard in agriculture and livestock to raise her children. She has been working in this business for several years and is doing well thanks to her hard work. Elena now needs a loan to buy minor species such as pigs, sheep and chicken as well as fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

The meetings of the communal bank “Virgen D. Natividad D. Chuso” take place every 30 days in Chuso in a member's house. The communal bank is maD. up of hardworking and enterprising people who are on the constant look-out for oppoortunities to get ahead. By working hard every day, they aim to give their children a better future. Most members live in Chusco and work in businesses such as selling food, minor species husbandry, selling grain, root vegetables and meat and crafts. Chuso is located an hour and twenty minutes drive from the city of Cusco. Cusco has been known for many years as the ""Archaeological Capital of America".

loans.use: to buy minor species such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, chickens and to buy fertilizers and seeds for farmland.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Señora Gabriela es de la ciudad de Santaní. Tiene una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, hace más de 7 años. Ella se define como una mujer my trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable.
Comenta que día a día se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para ir a surtirse con productos frescos. Ella es muy conocida en el barrio, por lo que se hizo de buena fama. Su objetivo es llegar a tener un Mini supermercado, donde pueda tener todos los articulos de primera necesidad, para que sus clientes encuentren todos en este lugar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles como panificados, carnes, además hortalizas, bebidas y demás para el abastecimiento del local. Ella está esperanzada en el crédito, ya que le será de gran ayuda. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señora Gabriela comes from the city of Santaní.  She has a well stocked storeroom in her home, which she has had for seven years.  She describes herself as a very hard-working woman, who is enterprising and responsible. She comments that she gets up very early in the morning on a daily basis to stock up on cold products.  She is very well known in her neighborhood, because she has earned a good reputation. 

Her goal is to have a mini supermarket, where she can stock all kinds of everyday items so that her customers can find everything in one place.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of food such as bakery items and meat, and also vegetables, drinks and other items for stocking her premises.

She is hopeful about the loan, as it will be of great help to her.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products, and other items to stock up her premises.

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago - Chacan Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Lucia está levantando la mano). 
La señora Lucia, tiene 29 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de Izcuchaca del distrito de Anta (Cusco) y ahora vive en la comunidad de Santiago de Chacan en el distrito de Anta de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace varios años en la comunidad y es donde realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Lucia tiene una relación de unión libre de donde tiene tres hijos, ella se esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos pues ella se dedica a brindar servicio de hacer llamada a celulares móviles y también se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son cinco meses que se dedica a este brindar este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Lucia requiere el préstamo para pagar el sueldo de personas que se encargaran de brindar el servicio de llamadas a celulares móviles. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Los Gigantes de Santiago - Chacan” son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Chacan en la casa de unas de las socias. El Banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Su población es indígena y habla el idioma quechua. Su ocupación principal es la agricultura, otros se dedican al comercio, tejedores, sastres. Las mujeres hacen trabajos de hilar lana, siempre que no tengan otra cosa que hacer.

La comunidad de Chacan se encuentra ubicada a una hora en carro de la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América".
texts.en:
(En la fotografía la socia Lucia está levantando la mano). 
(In the photograph, Lucia is the one raising her hand.)
Lucia is 29 years old. She was born in the city of Izcuchaca, in the district of Anta (Cusco) and she now lives in the community of Santiago de Chaca, in the district of Anta, in the province of Anta, in the department of Cusco. She has lived in the community for several years and this is where she works.

Lucia lives in a common-law marriage and has three children. She works hard to help her children get ahead. She has a business providing cellular phone call services and also works in agriculture and raises cattle. She has been offering this service [cell phone service] for five months and it has gone very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. At this time, Lucia needs the loan to pay the wages of the people she employs to provide the cellular phone call services. 

The meetings of the “Los Gigantes de Santiago – Chacan” communal bank take place every 30 days in the community of Chacan, in the house of one of the members. The communal bank is made up of people who are hardworking and enterprising who constantly look for opportunities to get ahead through their daily hard work so they can give their children a better future. The population is indigenous and people speak the Quechua language. Her main occupation is agriculture. Others work in sales, as weavers, and tailors. The women also spin wool when they’re not busy with other things.

The community of Chacan is located an hour by car from the city of Cusco. Cusco has been known for many years as the “Archeological Capital of America.”

loans.use: to pay the wages of the people she employs to provide the cellular phone call services.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 22 años vive en Salcedo cerca de Latacunga, vive con sus padres y un hijo varón que tiene 2 años de edad, Rosa se considera una persona trabajadora.

Trabaja en la crianza de animales, siembra de alfalfa; trabaja junto con sus padres. Trabaja con FODEMI por un tiempo de 1 año y medio, el crédito que solicita es para comprar semillas de alfalfa para sembrar.

Su sueño es encontrar una utilidad buena, tener mejores ingresos, y el sueño más grande es tener su propio terreno.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old and lives in Salcedo, near Latacunga, with her parents and her 2-year-old son.  She considers herself to be a hard-working person.

Rosa raises animals and grows alfalfa.  She works together with her parents.  She has been working with FODEMI for a year and a half and will use the loan that she is requesting to buy alfalfa seeds to sow.

Rosa's dream is to make good profits and better income.  Her biggest dream is to own her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eva Kelita

texts.es: Eva Kelita de 37 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque es una actividad que le gusta mucho, en su tienda vende frijol,arroz,sopas intantaneas,etc,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos comestibles ya que esta conciente de que le falta mas capital para agrandar mas su negocio,y tener mas bariedad en productos de primera nececidad,ya que ultimamente su clientela a umentado y no alcanza surtirles su producto en totalidad, el sueño de ella es darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro y de mas oportunidades.
texts.en: Eva Kelita de 37 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque es una actividad que le gusta mucho, en su tienda vende frijol,arroz,sopas intantaneas,etc,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos comestibles ya que esta conciente de que le falta mas capital para agrandar mas su negocio,y tener mas bariedad en productos de primera nececidad,ya que ultimamente su clientela a umentado y no alcanza surtirles su producto en totalidad, el sueño de ella es darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro y de mas oportunidades.

loans.use: Compra de Productos Comestibles de primera nececidad.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos, es soltero, vive con sus padres, se dedica al transporte de carga, tiene dos años de dedicarse a transportar arena, grava, tierra, piedra y bloques, este trabajo le provee los ingresos para solventar sus necesidades.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para el camión, ya que el eje y roster del camión necesitan ser reparados, el préstamo le ayudara a cubrir la compra de repuestos y pagar el mecánico.
Él quiere a través de su trabajo estabilizarse económicamente, y mantener el camión en buen estado.
texts.en:
Santos is single and lives with his parents.  He works in freight transport.  For two years he has worked transporting sand, gravel, earth, stone and cinder blocks; this work provides income to meet his needs.

He is currently seeking a loan for the purchase of spare parts for his truck, as the truck's transmission and axle need to be repaired.  This loan will help cover the purchase of the spare parts and pay the mechanic.

He wants to achieve financial stability through his work, and to keep the truck in good condition.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck's axel and transmission, also to pay the mechanic.

loans.name: Vilma Floridalma

texts.es: Vilma Floridalma: D. 65 años D. edad ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas los tres tiempos y ademas D. eso tiene su comedor, posee tambien su tortilleria la cual tiene desD. hace años, no cuenta que gracias a Dios le a ido bien en su negocio y a logrado aumentar un poco mas D. capital,esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. maiz por mayor ya que en este tiempo por las lluvias sube D. precio el mais pero ella tiene la oportunidad D. que si compra por mayor le venden mas barato,y otro para comprar productos comestibles para elavorar comida,ya que nos cuenta que siente que le falta capital para trabajar.
texts.en: Vilma Floridalma: D. 65 años D. edad ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas los tres tiempos y ademas D. eso tiene su comedor, posee tambien su tortilleria la cual tiene desD. hace años, no cuenta que gracias a Dios le a ido bien en su negocio y a logrado aumentar un poco mas D. capital,esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. maiz por mayor ya que en este tiempo por las lluvias sube D. precio el mais pero ella tiene la oportunidad D. que si compra por mayor le venden mas barato,y otro para comprar productos comestibles para elavorar comida,ya que nos cuenta que siente que le falta capital para trabajar.

loans.use: Compra de maiz para tortilleria, compra de productos comestibles para elavorar comida.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Xinia Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xinia es una señora de 49 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Las Bonitas de Platanares, localizada en Pérez Zeledón esto en la provincia de San Jose. Es una zona donde se presenta la actividad agropecuaria, los habitantes de la región en su mayoría son productores de café y de ganado doble propósito.

Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita dona Xinia es un micro crédito de ¢600,000(seiscientos mil colones), para la siembra y mantenimiento de su cafetal, por medio de almacigo y fertilizantes, para obtener una mejor producción del producto.

Dona Xinia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de las Bonitas, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas, y se tiene más información y acceso a créditos ya que con las entidades bancarias es muy difícil.
texts.en:
Xinia is a 49 year old woman who lives with her husband and children, in a community called Las Bonitas de Platanares, located in Pérez Zeledón which is in the province of San Jose.  It's a zone where agribusiness is common; the majority of the region's inhabitants are coffee producers and dual purpose cattle owners (who produce milk and meat).  

She says that having the support and help of her husband makes it possible for her to continue with the project. Moreover, she comments that the project is very exciting now that she has seen her business grow little by little and the demand for her products grow stronger each day because the community members have felt satisfied with the service she provides. 

What Dona Xinia is requesting now is a micro loan of ¢600,000 (six hundred thousand Costa Rican colones), for the sowing and maintaining of her coffee fields, using nursery seeds and fertilizers to achieve a greater production.

Dona Xinia is a member of the Common Credit Business of las Bonitas, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan, she hope to grow on both a personal and financial level.  She also emphasizes that thanks to these types of organizations and means of seeking loans, she can spend more time on productive activities, receiving more information and access to loans, whereas with the banking companies it is very difficult.

loans.use: to purchase nursery seeds and fertilizers to plant coffee

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años es separada, vive en Machachi con sus  3 hijos, María se describe como una persona luchadora, humilde de caracter fuerte pero lo que eela se propone lo cumple.


Trabaja por 4 años sola  en la venta de salchipapas (comida rápida). Trabaja con FODEMI cerca de tres años, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de una carpa para cubrir su negocio, los créditos le han ayudado bastante ya que puede sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Su sueño es incrementar su productividad y mejorar su negocio para poder vivir a plenitud con su familia que son sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and separated; she lives in Machachi with her three children.  Maria describes herself as a striving person, who is humble and a strong character, but achieves what she sets out to do.

She has been working on her own for four years selling salchipapas (fast food - fried potatoes with sliced hot dog).  She has been working with FODEMI for nearly three years.  This loan that she is requesting is to purchase a tent covering to cover her business.  The loans have helped a lot as she can move her children ahead in life.

Her dream is to increase her productivity and improve her business, so as to live her life to the fullest with her family, who are her children.

loans.use: to buy a tent covering to cover her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en:
Uputaua, age 43, owns and operates a business venture that involves baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Uputaua is requesting a loan in the amount of WST $1,000 to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, and cooking utensils used for baking.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business. Uputaua and her husband have five children.

Uputaua joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Uputaua's first loan through SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, and cooking utensils for baking

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer, vive junto a su esposa y su hija de un año de edad, el se dedica a la venta llaves, alarmas para automóviles, discos compactos, este negocio tiene varios años de existir, y hoy en día cuenta con varios clientes.
El quiere un préstamo para invertirlo en compra de CD musicales, material para hacer llaveros (argollas metalicas, hule de colores, cañamo), con esta compra mejorara su inventario para ofrecer a los clientes. Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio y ayudar a su familia con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Elmer lives with his wife and one year old daughter. He sells keys, car alarms, and compact disks. At present her has several customers.

He wants a loan to invest in buying music CDs and material to make keychains (metal rings, colored rubber, canvas). With this purchase, he will improve his inventory to offer his customers. His goal is to maintain his business and help his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and materials to make keychains (metal rings, colored rubber, canvas).

loans.name: Taufao

texts.en:
Taufao, age 65, owns and operates a bakery business in her local community. She has a year of experience in this business. Taufao hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of WST $1,000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients, such as baking powder and flavoring. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 230 talas or US $96 per week) to improve and expand the business. Taufao and her husband have four children. 
 
Taufao joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Taufao's first loan through SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients such as baking powder and flavoring

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florences, age 22, sells clay handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has one year of experience in this business. Florences needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase paints and carved designs with which to decorate her handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 760 talas or US $317 per week) to improve and expand the business. Florences and her husband have one child.
 
Florences joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Florences's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase paints and carved designs with which to decorate her handicrafts

loans.name: Atagai

texts.en:
Atagai, age 24, provides dressmaking services to local community members. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Atagai needs a loan in the amount of WST $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Atagai and her husband have one child.

Atagai joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Atagai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Lidieth De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Lidieth es una señora de 29 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Las Bonitas de Platanares, localizada en Pérez Zeledón esto en la provincia de San Jose. Es una zona donde se presenta la actividad agropecuaria, los habitantes de la región en su mayoría son productores de café y de ganado doble propósito.

Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita dona Lidieth es un micro crédito de ¢600,000(seiscientos mil colones), para la siembra y mantenimiento de su cafetal, por medio de almacigo y fertilizantes, para obtener una mejor producción del producto.

Dona Lidieth es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de las Bonitas, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas, y se tiene más información y acceso a créditos ya que con las entidades bancarias es muy difícil.
texts.en:
Lidieth is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children in a community called Las Bonitas de Platanares, located in Pérez Zeledón, in the province of San Jose. This is an area characterized by agricultural activity. Most of the region's inhabitants are coffee producers, while also raising livestock at the same time.

She says that she has the support and help of her husband, who makes it easier for her to continue with her project. She also says that her business is very interesting to her, since she has seen it grow little by little, with customer demand becoming gradually stronger, while her neighbors in the community have been satisfied with the service provided. 

At this time, Lidieth is requesting a microloan of ¢600,000 (six hundred thousand colones), to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant and maintain her coffee fields, so that she can improve the production level for her crop. 

Lidieth is a member of the Las Bonitas communal bank, one of EDESA's 110 partner organizations in Costa Rica. With this loan, she hopes to grow more on both the personal and economic levels. She also points out that thanks to this type of organization and facilitated loan services, she can dedicate more time to productive activities, and she has more information and access to credit, since working with banks is very difficult.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her coffee fields.

loans.name: Mauricio Mardoqueo

texts.es:
Mauricio, es empleado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, él está trabajando desde junio del 2008 en una empresa donde se encarga de monitorear los medidores del consumo de energía eléctrica, trabaja todos los días y debe caminar para recorrer las viviendas y controlando los medidores de energía de cada una.
Él necesita comprar uniformes y zapatos escolares para sus dos hijos, por tal motivo invertirá un préstamo en este gasto, garantizándole a sus hijos para que cuenten con lo necesario para su estudio. Su aspiración es que se superen los hijos, y en un futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en: Mauricio is employed and lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 8.  Since June of 2008, he has been working in a business which monitors the electric energy consumption meters.  He works everyday and must travel to the homes and read the electricity meters of each one.  He needs to buy uniforms and school shoes for his two children, and for this reason he will invest the loan in this expense, making sure his children have what is necessary for their education.  His aspiration is that his children will succeed and in the future become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms and school shoes for his two children.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, es madre soltera, vive con cuatro nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, cosméticos y lociones, este negocio tiene 30 años de existir, lo fundo por iniciativa propia, lo atiende de 5:00am a 2:00pm, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos cercanos.
Ella comprara maíz, leña y gas, para elaborar tortillas, esto le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio con el que espera continuar recibiendo ingresos y prestando un buen servicio a los clientes.
Esta inversión es con el propósito de mejorar, ayudando a sus nietos en sus estudios y proveyendo la alimentación necesaria para ellos.
texts.en:
Catalina is a single mother and lives with her 4 grandchildren. She sells tortillas, cosmetics, and lotions. Her business has existed for 30 years. She founded it on her own initiative, and she attends to it from 5:00 am until 2:00 pm. Her customers are neighbors and close friends.

Catalina will buy corn, firewood and gas to make tortillas, enabling her to strengthen her business. She hopes to continue receiving income while offering good service to her customers. With this investment she intends to bring improvement, helping her grandchildren in their studies and providing the food they need.

loans.use: buy corn, firewood, and gas to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 36 years old, married and has four children. She is starting a business venture raising pigs for sale. Eseta needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase iron roofing, nails, a hammer and a fence to build a shelter for cows.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Eseta joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, as they lack collateral. This is Eseta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase iron roofing, nails, hammer and a fence to build shelter for cows

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 44 years old, married and has three children. Emmy is starting a business venture involving planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Emmy needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as wheel-barrow, knives, axe and spade.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve her business.

Emmy joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Emmy's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as wheel-barrow, knives, axe and spade

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 43 years old, married and has two children. Amelia owns & operates a business venture selling soft drinks in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business.  Amelia needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase packets of foam cups, sacks of sugar and coolio (flavored soft drink).  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve her business.

Amelia joined SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Amelia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase packets of foam cups, sacks of sugar and coolio (flavored soft drink)

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 34 years old, married and has three children. Loreta owns & operates a business venture selling rice products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Loreta needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase sacks of rice.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve her business.

Loreta joined SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Loreta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 36 years old, married and has five children. Epenesa works in her business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Epenesa needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase farming equipment such as knives, spade and wheel-barrow. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 360 talas or US $150 per week) to expand her business.

Epenesa joined SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Epenesa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment such as knives, spade and wheel-barrow.

loans.name: Las Dulces Orquideas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Janet  es divorciada, tiene 2 hijas en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Dulces Orquídeas” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Janet  trabaja desde hace  3 años en la venta de anticuchos, pancita y picarones , este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio,  ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a sus 2  hijas  y es así que empezó vendiendo en la puerta de su casa anticuchos con el tiempo se hizo más conocida y ahora también vende picarones, a su vez ella recibe una pensión por alimentos de su ex esposo para sus  hijas ,  Janet  nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran sus hijas y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos,sus hijas cuentan con educacion personalizada, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería insumos , Sabemos que Janet  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en:
Janet is divorced with 2 daughters of school age and is currently a member of “Las Dulces Orquideas” (The Sweet Orchids) Group, composed of 10 members who are dedicated to diverse commercial activities. Janet has worked for 3 years selling kebabs, tripe, and fritters. The business began in response to her divorce, since she needed to work to support her 2 daughters. That's why she began selling kebabs at her front door. In time she became better known and now she sells fritters too. At the same time, she also receives food payments from her ex-husband for her daughters.

Janet tells us that she is succeeding with much work and perseverance because she is motivated by her daughters and her desire to get ahead is greater than her problems. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has  achieved a higher economic income and her daughters can count on a personalized education. With the goal of continuing to grow, she is requesting a new loan to buy supplies and merchandise. We know that Janet will satisfy her objectives with much work and effort and that these loans  through Edaprospo will aid her.

loans.use: buy supplies (Meat, masa for tortillas, etc.) to make and sell kebabs, fritters, etc.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan, age 53, sells such items as candles, toilet paper, matches, soap, and cleansers from a sales point he rents at the Tsagaan-Uul trade market. He started his retail business in 1998. He lives with his family in a "ger," a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife is on a disability pension and his daughter works at a local organization.

Bayarsaihan's family members help him to run the business. With the profits he has earned from his business, he is now building a house. However, his business is in lack of capital liquidity. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy more goods to increase his capital turnover.  

Bayarsaihan is a hardworking and diligent man who tells us that "I want to build my own house and buy a car by buildng a successful business."

loans.use: to buy more goods to offer for sale, thereby increasing his capital turnover

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is a local farmer living in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. To generate income and provide sustenance for the family, Herminio devotes himself full-time to sowing, planting, and harvesting rice from his half-hectare of farmland. He has been engaged in this business for three years. 

He wakes up early and immediately goes to the rice field, a 10-minute walk along his house. When he harvests his crop, Herminio sells the produce to traders. Income generated from the business, amounting to P 25,000, is generally spent on school fees and household expenses such as food and electric bills. Herminio's spouse works as a housekeeper and takes care of their three children. 

Herminio is requesting a loan of P11,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor costs for land cultivation and the transplanting of rice seedlings. He is confident that the help of this loan will help his operation improve crop production.

In the future, Herminio would like to earn consistent profits so that he can save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for land cultivation and the transplanting of rice seedlings

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, age 49, earns her living by engaging in a farming business. She and her husband plant, harvest, and sell rice. Usually, they earn about P15,000 per cropping season during the month of May and November. They have four children and the family lives in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. Her primary goal is to ensure a quality education for her children.

According to Julia, profits earned are not enough to sustain all the family's needs. Julia wants to earn additional money and achieve an abundant harvest, so she is asking for a loan of P12,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor costs involved in the sowing and transplanting of rice seedlings in the field. Labor cost is an additional burden for them but, due to their inability to involve themselves in sowing and transplanting rice seedlings, they need additional laborers to help them with these activities. Julia believes this loan will be beneficial for her in strengthening her farming business.

In the future, Julia hopes to see all her children fully educated.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor costs involved in the sowing and transplanting of rice seedlings in the field

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old and married with four children.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Arlyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and earns additional income from dried fish vending and rice and corn retailing.

Arlyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, age 47, and her husband are rice farmers. They have been cultivating rice for 20 years. During the last cropping season in May, Edna earns P30,000 from her crop. They used it for paying bills at home, paying school fees, covering daily expenses, and saving for future emergencies. For additional income, Edna also raises hogs. 

Edna and her husband have one child. 

She is now asking a loan of P28,000 in order to buy seeds and insecticides used in farming as well as to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. With her determination and patience to succeed, she will make her crop more productive and diversify her hog-raising business for additional income. 

In the future, she would like to keep improving sales from her businesses so as to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and insecticides used in farming as well as to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Chenalyn

texts.en:
Chenalyn is 26 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chenalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Chenalyn has been raising pigs for one year and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, age 62, is a food vendor. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Together, their income is $5 per day. They have three grown children, ages 19, 20, and 23. All of them are working in a factory at a wage of $8 per day. 

Every month, Heang has to spend $118 on food, $10 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses. 

Heang would like to request a loan in the amount of $400 in order to buy a fishing boat for her husband that can be used during the rainy season. This will allow the family to earn an additional income.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat for her husband that can be used during the rainy season

loans.name: Novy

texts.en:
Novy is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Novy is 55 years old and has one child who is in school.

Novy has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Novy requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

Novy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Novy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, groceries etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en: Sochea, 34 years old, is a farmer and animal seller. His wife is a garment factory worker.  Their income is $5 per day.  He has four children, all of whom are studying.  Every month, he has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $600 to buy food for feeding pigs, and fertilizer for his farm.  In the future, he wants to raise more pigs at home so that he can have enough money to send all of his children to finish high school at least.

loans.use: To buy food for feeding pigs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 60 years old and a widow with seven children.

Loreta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Loreta has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Loreta aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 50 years old and married with 10 children.

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a pig raising business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs .

Rosita has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pig raising business for two years and earns additional income from her sari-sari store and raising cows.

Rosita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mercita

texts.en:
Mercita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children.  Mercita sells clothing products like t-shirts, blouses, underwear & ornamental decorations. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy clothing products to sell.  Mercita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mercita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional items for her beauty salon business.

Susan has been in this business for 24 years. Susan earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear and other beauty products.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her beauty salon

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 50 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Phoebe works very hard to provide for them. Phoebe buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell. Phoebe has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Phoebe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Ferlie

texts.en:
Ferlie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years now. Ferlie requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

In the future, Ferlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 7 children.  Rosie has a shop that sells snacks, biscuits & beverages, like soft drinks and energy drinks. She has had this business for 40 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.  Rosie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Rosie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling detergents in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Jenely has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jenely would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: purchase more detergent to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 62 years old and married with 4 children. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, groceries, etc..

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for 14 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Oeung, age 55, is a farmer who earns $1.50 per day. She is a single mother with four children, two of whom are studying in school. The other two are employed and earn $3 per day each. 

Every month, Oeung has to spend $60, including $10 on her house rental, $15 on school fees, and $10 on household expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to buy columns and wood for repairing her house. This loan will help her family to have a good house in which to live. 

In the future, Oeung wants to send her daughter to study tailoring, and she will help her to get a small tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: to buy columns and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, age 50, is a widow with six children. She prepares and peddles snack items, such as rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for two years. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 in order to buy raw ingredients for preparing snacks.

Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for preparing snacks

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, 59 years old, is selling groceries with her husband. Their income is $15 per day. They have one child staying with them and helping to sell the grocery goods. He is 21 years old.  Every month, Saran has to spend $38 on food, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy more goods to sell.  She wants to save profits in order to repair her house for her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed, with 7 children.  Leonora has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. Leonora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 51, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Her husband is Gerardo, a carpenter, and they have two children. The oldest is already working while the youngest is still in high school.  Juanita, her husband, and their children manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Juanita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Juanita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Juanita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, age 45, is a fish farmer. She and her husband raise fish to offer for sale, and their income is $4 per day. They have three children: one is studying in school, and the other two are employed in a factory and earn $4 per day each. 

Every month, Sokhorn has to spend $51 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on household expenses. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $500 in order to buy a pumping machine and additional fish. In the future, she hopes to send her youngest child to university when he finishes high school.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine and additional fish to raise and offer for sale

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia, age 56, operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells them at a small profit. Her products are slippers, sandals, and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy her merchandise due to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. She has to work hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  
 
Pelagia lives in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines, with her husband Agustin, who works as a welder, and their children. Pelagia has managed to afford her older children's schooling. The entire family helps each other to manage their household while operating the business.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Pelagia dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes eventually to have her own equipment for making slippers and sandals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities and varieties of products so as to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly, 32 years old, is a goldsmith. His wife does farming at home.  Their income is $7.50 per day. He has one child who is 8 years old and studying at school. Every month, he has to spend $41 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy clothes and VCDs for his wife to sell in front of the house. This loan can help his wife to have a career for earning money to support the family. In the future, he hopes to have enough money to get a small shop for making gold to sell by himself, because now he is working in another’s shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes and VCDs for his wife to sell from home

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
This is Genalyn, a 27-year-old resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines, who is married to Jerwin, a barber, and the mother of one child. By the grace of God, Genalyn has managed to support her child's schooling while she and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Genalyn operates a buy and sell business, purchasing general merchandise from wholesalers and then reselling it for a small profit. Her products are footwear, sandals, etc., and customers are attracted to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations, Genalyn is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Genalyn dreams of having another store and giving her child a good and high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico, age 28, operates a buy-and-sell business. What he basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sells these items at a small profit. His products are children’s clothes, shorts, and other RTW (ready-to-wear) products. Customers are attracted to buy his wares due to the low selling prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Rico is an unmarried man and lives in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. He manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Rico dreams of having a permanent store in the marketplace and also of being able to provide support for his family. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory

loans.name: Dometilla

texts.en:
Dometilla, age 69, operates a piggery. She earns a living by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold at the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every week.

Dometilla and her husband Pascual live in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Pascual assists her with the business. Together they work hard to provide a safe and secure future for their family.

To help her continue operations of her business, Dometilla is requesting a Php 12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Dometilla hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional hogs

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
This is Razel, who is 45. She is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Loloy, a driver, and is a mother to her only child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Razel operates a doormat business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She makes door mats out of excess textile cloth she buys from the factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She is also into peanut-butter making. She directly sells her products to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric and thread. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Razel hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business, like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
This is Cleofe, who is 49. She is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, her business partner. She is a mother of two children who are already working. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Cleofe operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands (dishes) cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 850 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php17, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cleofe dreams to make her business grow in the coming years and hopes to maintain her good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato demonstrated patience in his business. He has been a farmer for 15 years. He works all day in the field, and this occupies his daily schedule. According to him, being a farmer requires endurance and strong determination. 

Renato raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future sale. He is generating an income to provide sustenance for his family. He goes down to the field every day to visit his crop. He has two children to educate. With the profit of 30,000 pesos last harvest season of May, his wife (Marlyn) encountered difficulties in budgeting for all their expenses. Marlyn uses it to pay matriculation fees, electric bills and to buy grocery items, too.
 
Renato wants to achieve an abundant harvest; he needs additional capital for his farming business. He is now asking for a loan of 10,000 pesos to buy seeds, pesticides and insecticides used in farming.

Renato hopes that he will yield better crops and generate more income for the next harvest season of November.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, age 28, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 in order to purchase more products to stock in her general store. Geraldine and her husband have three children and the family lives in Ibabao, Siquijior, Siquijor.

Geraldine has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months. She hopes to pay off her installments on her motorcycle in the near future as a resuklt of the increase in income of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock in her general store

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru:
Исматулло шустрый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. Когда ему было 18 лет он начал свой собственный бизнес. Он начал реализовать хлопковое масло и пшеничную муку. Он покупает товар с других рынка районов, а продает на местном рынке. Он старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и обеспечит нужд своих детей. Кроме этого Исматулло дома занимается скотоводством. Исматулло хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал и расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он заранее благодарит всех за поддержку и поощрение.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
