While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Ismatullo is a smart and honest man. He is married and is a father of three children. When he was eighteen years old he started his own business. He began to sell cotton oil and wheat flour. He buys his product from markets in other regions and then sells in on the local market. He tries to provide for his family with best living conditions and satisfy the needs of his children. Besides this Ismatullo does animal husbandry at home. He wants to increase his working capital and expand his business. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $2,000USD with this purpose. Ismatullo is thanking everyone for the support and encouragement in advance.

loans.use: to buy cotton oil and wheat flour

loans.name: Sharifakhon

texts.ru:
Шарифахон умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и мать 4 детей. Более 16 лет Шарифахон занимается купля продажей домашних обуви и детских одежд. Она торгует на центральном местном рынке и у неё много постоянных клиентов. Она продает свои товары по низким ценам, чтобы привлечь еще много новых клиентов и максимизировать свою прибыль. Шарифахон хотела бы получит займ в размере 1300$ США для покупки домашних обуви и детских одежд, чтобы расширит свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она хочет заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу помощь и милосердие.

texts.en:
Sharifakhon is a smart and honest women.  She is married and the mother of four children.  For more than sixteen years she has made her living buying indoor shoes and children's clothing and selling them in the central market to her many steady customers.  She sells her goods at low prices to attract a lot of new customers and maximize her earnings.  

Sharifakhon is seeking a loan of 1300USD to buy indoor shoes and children's clothing so she can expand her business and maximize earnings.  She would like to thank all of you in advance for your help and loving-kindness.

loans.use: to buy indoor shoes and children's clothing.

loans.name: Shakila's Group

texts.en:
Shakila is married and her husband is a master tailor. His shop is located in the nearby market from where he operates his business. He is known among his clients as an expert in his work and receives regular orders every month. 

Shakila is also a seamstress and offers her services to her neighboring clients on reasonable rates. Her good stitching helps her in getting more orders every month which allows her to manage the household expenses. 
 
She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Shakila has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her clothes sewing business. With the loan, she will purchase a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders in a shorter period of time and make more income. She has been operating her business for the past 15 years and is very much sure that after the loan investment she will be able to operate her business better and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shakila.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, age 44, has a dressmaking business and earns approximately PHP 7,900 each month from her work.  She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to purchase cloth for use in her dressmaking business.

Salvacion and her husband have five children and live in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. In the future, Salvacion hopes to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for use in her dressmaking business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, age 53, owns and operates a shop that sells such items as canned goods, noodles, bread, toothpaste, and soap. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 in order to purchase more grocery items.

Rosa and her husband have three children and live in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosa hopes to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлуба добросовестная трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Её муж является бизнесменом.  Доход мужа не позволяет им полностью покрывать все расходы семьи, из-за этого она решила помогать мужу и открыла свой собственный бизнес. Более 21 лет она занимается купля продажей обуви и детских одежд. Она имеет сою торговую точку на центре местном города, а также много клиентов. Матлуба   хотела бы получит займ в размере 1250$ США для покупки новых ассортиментов модных обувей. Она хочет заранее благодарит Киву и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и доброту.

texts.en:
Matluba is a conscientious, hardworking woman. She is married and a loving mother to three children. Her husband is a businessman. Her husband's income is not enough to cover all of the family's expenses. Because of this, she decided to help her husband and opened her own business. For more than 21 years, she has been engaged in buying and selling shoes and children's clothes. She has her own shop in the center of the city, as well as many clients. Matluba is requesting a loan of $125 US to purchase a new assortment of stylish footwear. She thanks Kiva and Kiva lentors in advance for their support and kindness.

loans.use: Purchase a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is married and has 4 children. She is 59 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Carmen sells noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP14,900 to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

Carmen has been a member of PMPC for  6 years. In the future, Carmen hope to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 60 years old and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 6 children. 

To earn a living, Lilian has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. Lilian has a requested a loan of PHP14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

Lilian has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Lilian would like to become a successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Maria Gracia

texts.en:
Maria Gracia is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Maria Gracia is providing motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and to pay for the gasoline for the transportation service.

Maria Gracia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maria Gracia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Bitcherose

texts.en:
Bitcherose is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Bitcherose has a bakeshop where she sells breads, biscuits, pastries & cakes. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

Bitcherose is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bitcherose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Mona has a retail shop she she sells blouses, t-shirts, sandals & shoes. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional products like clothing & shoes to sell.

Mona is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products like clothing & shoes to sell.

loans.name: Colonne De Feu Plus Group

texts.en:
Annie, from Kinshasa DRC, is the 46-year-old group leader of a 20-member group loan named “Colonne de Feu Plus” offered by MFI HOPE DRC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Annie, who is married, has five children between 16 and 25 years old. Three of her children attend school. Annie has been selling soya beans and miscellaneous since 1994 in the western part of Kinshasa. Currently, her business brings in a profit of US$60 per week. Annie plans to use the coming loan from Hope to increase her inventory by purchasing one more soya bean sack for reselling at profit in order to increase her income. Annie has a point of sale within her community. She dreams one day to open a large soya bean facility in her environment.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing one more soya bean sack for reselling at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Aida has a retail shop where she sells home products like kitchen utensils, curtains & bed sheets. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy home products for sell.

Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Ally is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Ally has a food shop that sells lechon, or roasted pig, per kilograms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy pigs for lechon, or roasted pig.

Ally  is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs for lechon or roasted pig business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Liza has a retail shop where she sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Liza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married but has no children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elsa is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase farm fertilizer. 

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. She hopes to buy basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs or fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 58-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 34 years old and the youngest is 25.

Ana and her husband are both farmers. They till a land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Rice is the main crop that they grow and sell. Ana works hard to improve their business and support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Ana hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.  She is 39 years old, married to John, and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods for resale in her retail shop, like sugar, bread and salt.

In future, Patricia hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods for resale, like sugar, bread and salt.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 60 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena. He is widowed with eight children. 

He works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 5 years. He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase fishing equipment including nets and hooks.
 
Pedro has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. He hopes to buy piglets to sell in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment such as hooks and fishing nets.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a retail shop that sells bananas, snacks, breads and ice candies. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Amie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 46 years old and is married to Saphine. They have eight children. Michael is a tailor by profession and is applying for a loan to enable him to buy more materials to add to his stock and also to buy another sewing machine. He hopes to open up a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials to add to his stock.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, a 45-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jeana, where she has a business selling fish, earning about PHP 10,000 each month.

A member of PMPC for five years, Elvira has requested a loan for PHP 15000 to purchase additional equipment and fish for her business. She would like to have enough money for her future and the daily living requirements of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and fish for her business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 23 years old and married woman with one child. Her child is still too young for school. She has a business selling drugs in a clinic in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell in her clinic

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and lives in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena. She is married with three children. She works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for seven years. 

She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase a variety of fish to sell. Ruth has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and has two children, one of whom works.

Ahmad has owned a women's clothing shop since 2000. He has good experience in this field and has a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to buy a generator, a split air conditioner and an aluminum counter with a chair. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a generator, a split air conditioner and an aluminum counter with a chair.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel. She is married with eight children. Evelyn has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase a variety of goods for resale. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, she hopes to have more income and savings from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for resale.

loans.name: Tehmina's Group

texts.en:
Tehmina is a working lady and supports her husband financially by doing clothes stitching for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. 

She is the mother of four children. All of them are studying in a local school except the youngest one who is only 5 years old and hasn’t started his education yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is an electrician by trade. He operates his shop in the market from where he offers electrical item repair services to his customers. He is very good in his work and has kept good knowledge of his work. With the loan, he will buy electrical repair tools that will allow him to offer better quality repairing services to his customers. Tehmina hopes that an investment will bring more profits to him and will improve the living standard of his family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Tehmina.

loans.use: To buy electrical item repair tools.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years, married and has four children.

Karar has been an owner of a bakery since 2007, where he sells and makes pastries and bread. He has good experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to build a stone oven and to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to build a stone oven and to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena raises hogs for future sale. She has been doing it for three years. This serves as the source of her income which her family relies on to maintain their basic needs such as food and medicines. She has five children to provide for, especially their education. Buena earns about PHP 5,000 with each pig sale.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. She needs additional capital for maintaining her hogs in order for her to  offer them for sale at a higher cost when they are ready.

Buena wants to strengthen her business and construct a more convenient pig pen.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has six children.

Saad has owned a store since 2003, selling all kinds of barley and wheat. He has good experience in this field and has a good reputation. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,700 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Tipolo, Plaridel. She sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for less than one year. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients used for making the snacks she sells. Glenda has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, she hopes to have more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and other ingredients used for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Mudasir

texts.ru:
Мудасир добросовестная и честная женщина. Она замужем и мать 3 детей. Она всегда старается улучшить свою жизнь и зарабатывать много денег. Она когда-то уехала в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать, она там работала несколько лет, а затем вернулась домой и открыла свой бизнес. Теперь около 2 лет она  занимается приготовлением блюд на местном поликлиники города. Врачи, медсестры и другие работники поликлиники часто посещает её столовую, и она хочет приготовит много разных вкусных блюд для своих клиентов. На хранение продуктов ей нужно холодильник, чтобы продукты сохранили свою свежесть и не испортились. С этой целью Мудасир запрашивала займ на сумму 1000$ США.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mudasir is a conscientious and honest woman. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She always tries to better her life and earn a lot of money. She once went to Russia to earn a living, where she worked a few years before then returning home and opening her own business. Now, for more than 2 years she has been in the business of preparing meals at a local city health clinic. Doctors, nurses and other clinic workers often eat at her cafeteria and she wants to prepare many different and delicious meals for her clients. In order to store the food, she needs a refrigerator to ensure the groceries stay fresh and do not spoil. To this end, Mudasir is requesting a loan of $1000 US. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old. She is a widow with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling beans and sugar in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the profit from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
40-year-old Anita is a married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old.  Like most people in her town, Anita is engaged in farming. She plants rice and vegetables on her land. She sells her harvest at the market and earns enough for her family's food and other basic needs. She is also able to send her children to school through her earnings.

Anita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to earn more and be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has four children.

Ghanem is an owner of a shop selling clothes and fabrics since 2002.  He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation; and he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls, to make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls, to make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 58 years old and lives in the municipality of Sinacaban in Misamis Occidental Province. He is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Rudy has a business selling milkfish. He earns about 3000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Rudy has requested a loan for 9000 PHP to purchase feed for the milkfish.

Rudy has been a member of PMPC for 3 months.  In the future, Rudy would like to have bigger fish cages.

loans.use: to purchase feed for milkfish.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
At age 39, Shirley patiently sells fruits and vegetables house-to-house. She has been doing it for three years to generate income for the education of her three children.

In a week, she usually earns 2,000 PHP. According to her, the profits earned were not enough to sustain all the needs of the family. She needs to sell more fruits and vegetables to increase the capacity of her sales and to boost her profits.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy bananas, mangoes, tomatoes, and cabbage to sell.

In the future, she hopes to have a stall in the market.

loans.use: to buy bananas, mangoes, tomatoes, and cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Frecia

texts.en:
Frecia has practiced farming in the Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 34 years old and is married to Moses, and they have three children who attend school.  

Frecia was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar has been the owner of a men's clothing shop since 2005. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation, and he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.


He is requesting a $2400 loan to make an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To make an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door.

loans.name: Rehmat's Group

texts.en:
Rehmat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s fruit-selling business. He puts different varieties of fruit on his cart every day in the morning and visits different streets of the city for selling. He is very fair in his rates and makes good sales every day. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell on his cart. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past 15 years. Rehmat is confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment. 

She is the mother of four sons. All of them are illiterate and do different kinds of work to support the family financially. Rehmat herself is a housewife and  spends her time staying at home and performing her household responsibilities. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rehmat.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for fruit-sales business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is single parent with two children. Vilma has a shop that sells items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and more. She has had this business for the past two years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more of these above items.

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for 5 years and hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling sugar and maize flour in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan she will use to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and flour to sell

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, single and lives with five family members who all work.

Bahaa has been an owner of a store since 2008, selling and making pastries, sweets and juices. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls and to make a showcase and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls and to make a showcase and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand is a 38-year-old married man with two children who are one and eight years old. He lives in his own permanent house in Ilagan, Isabela. For five years, Ferdinand has been in the motorcycle transport business. In addition, his wife operates a store. From these businesses, he has been able to buy a motorcycle. He faces the challenge on the fluctuation of fuel prices but hopes to buy another motorcycle to increase income. Ferdinand wanted to avail a loan to a avail an installment second hand motorcycle and to buy new tires for his motorcycle so he could provide smooth transportation service.

loans.use: to a avail an installment second hand motorcycle and to buy new tires for his motorcycle so he could provide smooth transportation service.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with three family members.

Moustafa has owned a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy an electric generator and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator and to add more foodstuffs to his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kitembe Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Wisex is a 33-year-old married man with three children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to start  an income generating activity for his wife so as to boost his income. He has been selling medicines for three years but his major hardship has been inadequate capital to invest in the business and his goal is to have a pharmacy in the next four years.

Wisex needs the loan to buy drugs for resale.

loans.use: To buy medicines for resale.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 50 years old, and his wife, Bun, is 48 years old. They have been married since 1985 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of their children are married. Two of their children are garment workers, and another child is in school. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Pov is a remoque taxi driver. A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. His wife is a farmer. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is married with no children. Rosenda is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosenda is a farmer and grows vegetables and rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 pesos to purchase fertilizers. 

Rosenda has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Rosenda hopes to improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old and lives in the municipality of Lopez Jaena. She is married and has three children.

Elizabeth works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a container of fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to save for her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase a container of fish to sell.

loans.name: Amid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children.

Amid has been an owner of a food market since 2006 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products, etc. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou (pictured here), 21, is single. She lives with her parents and brothers and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Penh.   

Chanthou is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work because she does not have her own transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy soap and sugar.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and lives in the municipality of Plaridel. She is married and has four children.

Letecia works in the fishing industry. She catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat.

Letecia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Letecia hopes to save for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is 35 years old and married with six children. Two of the children are in school. She has a business selling mandasi (a donut-like pastry) in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Agness requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this losan to buy grinding machines in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and ngano flour to make mandazi to sell

loans.name: Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Shazil, who is in his late 20s, is married and has one small child. He has been running a fruit and vegetable business for eight years now. He works from 5:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania in the middle of the main loan. It is intended to motivate a borrower with a good credit rating who pays back his or her loan smoothly by allowing him or her to receive half the amount of the existing loan before the original loan term has ended. Shazil used his previous loan to increase his business's stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase his fruit stock. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Shazil will share this loan with his loan group "Mkombozi," which has a total of nine members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase on fruit stock.

loans.name: 1 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liễu has a service business providing housing rentals. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build a house for rent.

Liễu is 47 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 1 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. Liễu lives with her three dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liễu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liễu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liễu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liễu hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy more land of her own, and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a house for rent.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with three family members, two of whom work. 

Since 2009, Ali has been the owner of a cafeteria  where he prepares all kinds of drinks and foods. He has a good experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and his cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $3000 in order to renovate his cafeteria and to pay the annual rent and to buy grilling machinery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his cafeteria and to pay the annual rent and to buy grilling machinery.

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Ravy (in the photo) is 27 years old, while her husband is 36 years old. They have been married since 1992 and have two children--one S. and one daughter. They live in a village fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Ravy is a garment worker, while her husband is a farmer. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Okiljon

texts.ru:
Окилчон целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Его жена работает врачом в роддоме. Окилчон занимается купля продажей сухофруктов и более 8 лет он продолжает расширить этот бизнес. Он покупает сухофруктов оптом, а затем реализует их на местных рынков. Его жена помогает ему для сортировки сухофруктов. Он хочет расширит свой бизнес и увеличить свой оборотный капитал для этого ему необходимо дополнительные ресурсы, из-за этого он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Okiljon is a motivated and conscientious man. He is married and the loving father of 4 children. His wife is a doctor in a maternity clinic. Okiljon buys and sells dried fruits and has continued to expand this business for more than 8 years. He purchases dried fruits in bulk and then sells them at local markets. His wife helps him sort the fruit. He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. To do this he needs additional resources and is requesting a loan of $1000 US.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty-three-year-old married man with eight children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been  operating a retail and bar shop for three years and he started the business with the savings he had got from selling tea. His hardships are debtors, inflation and high transport costs. His vision is a wholesale business plus an educated family.

Moses needs the loan facility to buy salt, sugar and beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman (pictured here) is a widow with three married children--two sons and one daughter. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saman is asking for a loan of $200 to buy a new motorbike for her daughter who is a garment worker to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to  work.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 55 years old and married to Lucy.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 39 years old. She is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 20 years old, and the youngest child is 4 years old.

Divina is a farmer who works in the town of Surallah in South Cotabato Province. She and her husband own and till a piece of land where they grow rice and vegetables. Divina works hard to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. Divina is hoping to have a better yield and to be able to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
Nath (in the photo) is a rice farmer, assisted by her children. She also sells "onsorm" when she is not at the farm. "Onsorm" is a type of Cambodian cake that has rice and coconut with soybeans and pork in the middle.

Nath is a widow with two sons and two daughters. She is requesting a loan of $700 to continue her farming business by purchasing a motorized hand tiller and buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized hand tiller and buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun (pictured with her young son) sells meatballs and roasted chicken wings in her village. Her husband, Sopheak, is a security guard. They have been married since 2006 and just have one young son. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives because part of it is in poor condition.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Uganda.  She is single and has five children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans from her late brother). 

Norah has a business of knitting sweaters and tablecloths.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Norah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Norah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy threads and needles for knitting sweaters and rolls of cloth. The main business challenges for Norah include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to employ girls to assist in knitting and also to acquire a knitting machine.    

Norah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more more thread, needles, and rolls of cloth.

loans.name: 2 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to resell.

Hương is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 2 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. 
Hương lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In future, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with four children. Marites is 38 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Marites sells canned goods, noodles, soap, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,600 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more goods such as canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

Marites has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Marites hopes to have a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. 

Riyad has been the owner of a store since 2006, selling cosmetics, shoes and accessories for women. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 


He decided to apply for a loan to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to mill.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng is a farmer who lives along National Road Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with seven children - four sons and three daughters. Heng is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help support her son by buying additional cows for sale. She will also use a part of the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To help support her son by buying additional cows for sale.

loans.name: Koemeng

texts.en:
Koemeng, 41 years old, and her husband, Veasna, 37 years old, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have three children - one son and two daughters. Two of the children are garment workers and one is in school.  

Koemeng is a garment worker and her husband is a motor taxi driver. Koemeng is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house and to do some house repairs.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and make house repairs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 46 years old. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling food in her restaurant in Kaya-road in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to buy cattle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to operate her restaurant

loans.name: Elisa Aparri Group

texts.en:
Elisa, 58 years old, is married and has 3 children. She lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao. Elisa has operated a business selling snacks for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks.

Elisa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. She is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a supply of milk.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Kunthy is a weaver and she also assists her husband in their farming business. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children - three sons and one daughter.   

Kunthy is asking for a loan of $500 to make repairs and stair rails for her house.

loans.use: To make repairs and stair rails for her house

loans.name: Saif

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married and has one child.

Saif has owned a shop since 2006, doing photocopying and selling stationery and mobile phones. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.


He is requesting a $2500 loan in order to buy a laser photocopier and to add more inventory to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a laser photocopier and to add more inventory to his shop.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
At age 51, Pedro still needs to be patient, and he works hard. He is married with six children. His wife is a housekeeper who also manages a retail business in which she sells vegetables like cabbage, carrots, beans, and potatoes.

Five of his children have finished their high school education, but he does not have enough money to send them to college. At present, his youngest child is in high school. Pedro's biggest dream is to send his child to college and for him to finish his studies and become a professional someday.

Pedro manages a corn farming business and a backyard hog raising business as well. He wanted to maintain and develop his hog raising business for additional income in order to support his child's education. He wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
For the last five years George has been operating a green grocer shop in Ngara. He is 38 years old and married to Lucy. They are blessed with four school-age children.

George was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This will be George's first loan. He intends to use the loan to add to his stock of tomatoes, onions, and cabbage.

In the future, George aspires to diversify into other businesses that will increase his income.

loans.use: to add to his stock of tomatoes, onions, and cabbage.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother). 

Hadjah   has a business selling soft drinks.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Hadjah sells her products door-to-door, retail.     

Hadjah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda and passion fruit.  The main business challenges for   Hadjah include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she can get permanent business premises.   

 Hadjah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda and passion fruit.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ester Group

texts.en:
Ester is 55 years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with three children. 

Ester works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Ester has been a member of PMPC for five years. 


Ester is the leader of a four-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 38-year-old married man with four children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His dream is to expand his shop and educate his children. He fabricates metal objects for resale and has been in this business for 12 years now. The major constraint faced is the unstable power supply and his dream is to set up a modern workshop. 

William  needs the loan to buy fabrication equipment so as to increase his daily output.

loans.use: To buy more fabrication equipment.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married with five children.  Angelina is 50 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor Province.

Angelina retails charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for three years.  Each month, she earns PHP 7,200 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of  PHP 10,000 to purchase more charcoal for her retail business.

Angelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eight months.  In the future, Angelina hopes to generate more income and able to deposit a big amount out of the profit of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for her retail business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is single with two children. Caroline is 48 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena.

To earn a living, Caroline has a general store business. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,500. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase a variety of grocery items. Caroline has been a member of PMPC for one year.

In the future, Caroline hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery items.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Ammar has been the owner of a barber shop since 2004. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Husein

texts.ru:
Хусейн целеустремленный и честный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец 4 детей. С 1996 года он начал свой собственный бизнес и успешно продолжает этот бизнес. Он занимается купля продажей сухофруктов и скотоводством. Он сам работает в данном бизнесе. Его жена работает в больнице. Он еще получает пенсию. Все эти доходы, которые он получает, полностью не покрывает все семейные расходы и он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший прибыль, чтобы покрывать все расходы. Хусейн хотел бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота и сухофруктов. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Husein is a driven and honest man. He is married and the responsible father of 4 children. From 1996 on, he started and successfully continued his own business. He buys and sells dried fruits and practices animal husbandry. He works in this business and his wife works at a hospital. He also receives a pension. All of the income that he receives does not fully cover all of the family's expenses, and he he wants to expand his business and earn an income that would cover all of these expenses. Husein is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase livestock and dried fruits.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle and dried fruits.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 61-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His major dream is to have enough money and be able to take his children to the best schools around the country. 

Robert is a cattle keeper and has been in practice for the last 20 years. His major challenge is pests and diseases that affect cows and his dream is to modernise his farm. Robert needs a loan to buy pesticides to keep his cattle healthy.

loans.use: To buy pestcides for his cattle.

loans.name: 3 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ works in agriculture as a poultry and cattle farmer. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle and feed.

Huệ is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Huệ is the group leader of the 3 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of five members. Huệ lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Huệ has been involved in this business for seven years.  The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle and feed

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina has been selling charcoal in Naivasha town for the last eight years.  She is 33 years old, married to Muruiki, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends and this will be her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy two sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, she hopes to move into other profitable sustainable businesses like opening a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 43-year-old married man with five children, lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after his family is vested in him and his dream is to educate his children.

Stephen has operated a retail shop for 20 years. His major challenge has been constant price fluctuations which affect demand for his products. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Stephen needs this loan to buy sacks of sugar, maize flour, cassava flour and soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sugar, maize flour, cassava flour and soap to sell.

loans.name: Norilyn

texts.en:
Norilyn, 32 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in Calalinan, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Norilyn has operated a general store for 6 years. She earns a monthly income of PHP 6,000 from the store. Norilyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Norilyn is a newly recognized member of Pagalum Multi Purpose Cooperative as of July 12, 2011. She hopes to alleviate her family's poverty with the help of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio, 58 years old, is married and has five children. His primary source of income comes from farming. To gain additional income, Dionicio has been raising hogs for the past two years.

Dionacio wants to expand his business to gain more income and to sustain his family's needs. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He looks to the development of his hog raising business to continue generating income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo, a 36-year-old married man with four children, lives with his family in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main dream is to construct a permanent house for his family.

Apollo owns a retail shop and also deals in a motorcycle transport business. His major challenge has been constant price fluctuations which affect his profits. His desire is to own a wholesale shop. Apollo needs this loan to buy sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. Regina has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables for 7 years. She works 6 days each week selling her products door-to-door, at the wholesale level. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

Regina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more oranges, passion fruits and mangoes in bulk. The main business challenges for Regina include seasonality and perishability. Her goals and hopes for her business are to see it grow big so that she starts growing fruits herself, opens up another stall in the same market and builds more rental rooms.

Regina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, passion fruits and oranges

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 35 years old, has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last two years. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend.  This will be Peter's third loan, with which he plans to renew the insurance cover for his motorcycle. 

In future, he hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will use to transport goods to and from the market

loans.use: To renew insurance cover for his motorcycle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, three of whom are in school. Mariam's business is selling charcoal in the market. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days every week. Mariam has requested for a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.

The main business challenges for Mariam include seasonality and defaulters. Her aspiration for the business is to see it grow from a retail enterprise to a wholesale business. Mariam lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcaol

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Agnes operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years and works 6 days a week. Apart from services, Agnes sells beauty products in the shop.

Agnes has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use, to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. The main business challenge for Agnes includes seasonality and defaulters. She aspires for her small salon to grow bigger, into a bridal salon. Agnes lives in a rental home that has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  clear land for  maize growing .

loans.name: 4 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hợp is 45 years old and married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 4 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. Hợp lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs Hợp has a retail business selling plastic goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to resell. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hợp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hợp faces in her business. is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hợp hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic goods to resell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has been a farmer for more than 20 years. Together with her husband, she tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato, where she plants rice crops. Elena also grows fruit trees and sells her harvest at the market.

Elena works hard to support her family of a husband and three children. She applied for a loan so that she could help fund their farm. She plans to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs.

In the future, Elena hopes to be rich. She also hopes for her children to finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last five years. He is 25 years old and married to Joyce; they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to plow his land and prepare it for planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To plow his land and prepare for planting.

loans.name: Neda'a

texts.en:
Nida'a from Al Zarqa, Jordan, is a 23-year-old woman and a mother of two children.

Nida'a is starting her business in decorating flowers and papers from the home of relatives and neighbors, but with her exceptional talent and hard work she could move her work to the nearby areas.

Nida'a is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase raw materials for her business and she is looking forward to opening a shop for her products.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a mother of one child to whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. She operates a tailoring services business at Kaloleni in Mombasa. She has been in this business for five years now and says that though the business is profitable, she has challenges of financial constraints. She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy materials to make clothes to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open another one. She describes herself as patient and courageous.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Pachedu Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! Entrance is 43 years old and from Masvingo. She is married with four children aged 11, 15, 20 and 24.  Two are attending school.  Entrance runs a retail business selling cosmetics, luggage, clothing accessories and blankets. The business has been in operation for 1.5 years. She says the main challenge she faces is insufficient working capital. Entrance has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock of clothing accessories. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Entrance plans to operate an outlet.

loans.use: to buy clothing accessories

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina has been operating her boutique and hair dressing salon for the last six years, She is a 32-year-old single lady.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of clothes for sale.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be able to export clothes outside the country.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maisa'a

texts.en:
Maisa'a is from Al Hashmi, Jordan. She is a 46-year-old woman and a mother of three children.

Maisa'a is making pastries from home, and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase raw materials and to start training courses for the neighbor women related to baking and doing pastries.

Maisa'a aspires to open a shop for her products and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and make training courses.

loans.name: 5 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sáu is the leader of a 6-member group, the 5 Phú Sơn 2 Solidarity Group. She has been involved in agriculture for 5 years, farming poultry and cattle. The main hardship that Sáu faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle and feed.

Sáu is 62 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sáu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Sáu hopes for her children to find good jobs, to travel for a vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle and feed

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она со всеми общается с улыбкою и всегда старается сделать всем добро. Она разведена, и она живет с ребенком одна. Более 5 лет она занимается выпечкой тортов, булочки, блинчики и пирожков и раздает их на местных магазинах города. Она также принимает заказы на торты для свадеб и других мероприятий. Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки муки и сахар на запас. Елена хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking and honest woman. She talks to everyone with a smile and always tries to do everyone well. She is divorced and lives alone with her child. For more than 5 years she has been in the business of baking cakes, muffins, pancakes and pies and distributing them to local stores in the city. She also takes orders for cakes for weddings and other events. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase flour and sugar for her stock. Elena wants to thank you all in advance for your help and support.
