loans.use: Покупка мука и сахар

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en: Bashar is a 21-year-old single man from Madaba, Jordan. He has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD purchase more products and expand the area of his store. Bashar is looking to add a frozen product sales line to his store and to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more products and expand the area of his store

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 56-year-old married man. For the last twenty years, he has been a cobbler in Emali.

Philip was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This will be his ninth loan, which he intends to use to buy an inventory of shoes and for land preparation. In the future, Philip hopes to diversify into other businesses which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy an inventory of shoes and for land preparation

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga.

Janice has been selling barbequed food for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase housing materials (cement, plywood, etc.) needed to repair her house. Janice has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials to repair her house

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Peggy from Masvingo. She is divorced with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Peggy runs a food business selling poultry. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge faced is insufficient working capital. Peggy has requested a loan of 300 USD to buy more chicks and material for fowl runs. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Peggy plans to supply big institutions.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and material for fowl runs

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 35 years old, widowed and has one child, aged 13, to whom she hopes to provide education to the university level. Anne operates a salon business in Mtongwe, Mombasa. She also supplies water and sells gas to the local people. Anne has been in this business for one year and says that, though the business is profitable, there are challenges of financial constraints.

Anne is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy hair weaves, gas and water to grow her businesses and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her businesses and diversify to real estate and farming. Anne describes herself as jovial, reliable and responsible.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, gas and water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, maize and millet flour for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has operated her tailoring shop for the last ten years in Oloitoktok. She is 47 years old and married to Thomas. They are blessed with two children.

Grace was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan, which she intends to use to increase her stock of cloth materials. In the future, Grace hopes  to venture into large scale farming.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cloth materials

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 40 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboaanga del Norte. She is married and has 3 children.

Dina has been selling fish for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase a fishing machine. Dina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Dina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and lives in Sebucao, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has 1 child.

Gina operates a business raising hogs and selling livestock, earning approximately PHP 6,000 monthly. She has requested this loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase livestock. Gina has been a member of PMPC for more than 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have her own piggery and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
Sofronia is a 60-year-old widow with 2 children. She lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City.

Sofronia has been selling “balut” for 2 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 1,000. Balut, a fertilized duck embryo that is boiled alive and eaten in the shell. is a popular streetfood in the Phillipines. Sofronia has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy balut eggs. Sofronia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her balut sales business.

loans.use: To buy "balut" eggs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 36 years old and married with three children. She does tailoring to earn a living. Besides tailoring, she does dairy farming for more income generation. She has been operating her businesses for over five years.  She has managed to transform her business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Mercy hopes to grow her business and become financially stable in the future. She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to add dairy cows.

loans.use: To add dairy cows.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has been operating a boutique in Oloitoktok town for the last three years. She is 26 years old and married to William. Together, they are blessed with two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of clothes in her boutique.

In the future, she hopes to open a chain of boutiques in Oloitoktok town.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes in her boutique.

loans.name: Minalona

texts.en:
Minalona is 44 years old and blessed with six children. She is sending four children to school. Minalona's eldest daughter did not continue her studies because she suffers from acute dysmenorrhoea. She can’t stay any longer in school; this is the primary reason why she stopped. Secondly, Minalona can’t afford to send them all to school because of the continuous medication of her child. Aside from raising hogs, she also accepts laundry for additional income.

She stated that there are nights she can’t sleep well due to her problems. She thinks about how and when they will end the difficulties in life. She tried to find for a better job, but unfortunately, she wasn't employed. She never experienced going to college and having a degree. She regrets that, but she can’t turn back time anymore. Right now, she is working hard in maintaining her business to sustain the needs of her children. 

She is requesting a loan amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy hog feed, and she is planning to buy another piglet to raise. Minalona almost gave up but with God's guidance, she keeps going. 

She hopes that she can surpass all these trials so that she can provide a successful life for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shares at the Nairobi Stock Exchange

loans.name: Kimiya

texts.ru:
Кимия замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Её муж является предпринимателем. Более 13 лет Кимия занимается купля продажей детской и подростковой одежды на местном рынке. У неё богатый опыт, и она с легка продолжает данный бизнес. Кимия хочет обучит своих детей в хороших  школах и университетах. Она хотела бы получит займ на сумму 1000$ США для покупки детскую и подростковую одежду с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарна всем за помощь и доброту. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Kimiya is married and the loving mother of 4 children. She is a conscientious and driven woman. Her husband is a businessman. For more than 13 years, Kimiya has bought and sold clothing for children and teens at the local market. She has extensive experience and she has easily kept her business going. Kimiya wants her children to study in good schools and universities. She is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase clothing for children and teens in order to expand her business. She thanks everyone in advance for their help and kindness.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and teens.

loans.name: Kabundaire United Ass Group

texts.en: Noah is a 33-year-old married man with two children. He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to own a big produce store in town. Noah owns a store containing maize and cassava flour and he has been operating it for 10 years. His major challenge has been inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands of his customers. Noah needs the loan to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother). Gorret has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for seven years and she works six days out of every week. Gorret sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale. Gorret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials and pieces of African attire (Bitenge). She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenge(s) for Gorret include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to see her business grow big so that she gets a tailoring school. Gorret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material and more pieces of African attire

loans.name: 6 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đậu operates a food stall selling pork pies and fermented pork rolls. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

Đậu is 51 years old and married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 6 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. Đậu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đậu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Đậu has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Đậu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Đậu hopes for her children to find a good job and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr:
Adidjatou est une femme  de 50 ans. Elle est mariée å un monsieur qui est retraité. Elle a 3 enfants qui sont tous actuellement dans la vie active. Le premier a 28 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.  
Adidjatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1989. Elle achète et revend des potasses à toute personne. Elle vend ses marchandises dans un marché local de Lomé. 
Adidjatou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des potasses. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adidjatou voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins en alimentation et santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adidjatou is a 50-year-old married woman with three children who have entered the workforce. The oldest is 28 years old, and the youngest is 22. Her husband is retired.

Adidjatou has been a reseller since 1989. She buys and sells potash to anyone and everyone. She conducts her sales at a local market in Lomé.

Adidjatou is seeking a third loan through WAGES to buy potash. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She plans to use the profits to provide for her family’s needs with respect to food and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy potash for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (an orphan). Jane has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. Jane sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Jane has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Jane include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she sells only on a wholesale basis. Jane lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chick mash for her chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lappa (a traditional cloth) for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop like bags of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat etc.,

loans.name: Kubatana Group

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Roselyn (raising her hand) from Masvingo, a town in southeastern Zimbabwe. She is single with two children who are both attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Roselyn runs a business doing interior decoration and cake making. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. Roselyn has requested a loan of $400 to buy cake ingredients and home decoration accessories. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Roselyn plans to open an outlet and take-away shop.

loans.use: to buy cake ingredients and interior decoration accessories

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married with three children. Judith is 46 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City.

Judith sells AVON and NATASHA products, viand (dishes) and snacks, and she operates an Internet café to earn a living. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP18,000 to buy meat and food ingredients for her viand and snack-vending business.

Judith has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Judith hopes to expand her Internet café shop.

loans.use: To purchase meat and food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Jefrey

texts.en:
At the age of 32, Jeffrey is married and has two school-aged children. He is married to a one and only loving woman, Lilibeth. They are both engaged in the farming business, in which they plant and harvest corn.

Jeffrey is also engaged in a hog-fattening business but it is not stable because he don’t have enough capital to continue operating it. At present, Jeffrey temporarily stopped his hog-raising business. He wishes for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy piglets to raise. He will use the loan wisely to be able to continue operating his business.

In the future, Jeffrey wants to expand his business for it to become a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for his food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional provision such as sugar, sardines, margarine, milk, tea and coffee for her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson wants a loan to buy produce and to prepare land for cultivation. He is a Ugandan man, aged 53 years, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Jackson has six children and a wife. He has been operating a maize mill for 20 years and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Gaime

texts.en: Gaime lives in West Point. She is 39 years old and stopped her education in seventh grade. She's single and has two children between 16 to 20 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past 11 years, she has been selling red oil. She started this business selling cold water with money given to her by her sister. Some of the problems she is facing are warehousing and less commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase red oil for business. She plans to build a shop with a warehouse, to build her house and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase red oil for business.

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is married and her husband is a vegetable seller. He operates his shop in the community market and sells good quality fresh vegetables to his customers at reasonable rates. Uzma supports her husband financially by doing sewing work. She learned this art from her mother and now she earns a reasonably good income every month. This income helps her pay utility bills and the children's school fees. She is the mother of four children. Her eldest son is a butcher and sells chicken meat and the others are studying in a local school.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables that will allow him to make better profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past eight years. Uzma is confident about the positive growth of his business after the loan investment. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Uzma.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal  vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 35-year-old man. He is married and has three children aged between nine and two years old to whom they hope to give a good education to university level. He runs a general store at Kimongo in Kitengela in which he sells such items as plates, cups and thermos flasks. He has been running this business for three years now and has managed to give employment to one person. 

Lawrence says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that his business is doing well. He is using his loan of KES 24,500 to buy more household items to grow his business to wholesale and to meet the demands of his customers. He describes himself as a visionary person.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling sugar in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more sugar to sell. She says that she wants to buy cows and goats with the extra income from her loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete his rental house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Toir

texts.ru:
Тоир добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Тоир любит свою семью и старается, содержат их в хороших условиях жизни. Он хочет, видит своих детей в будущем образованными, честными и трудолюбивыми людьми. С этой целью он начал заниматься выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур в 2001 году. Он выращивает пшеницу, картошки, помидоры, рассольник, арбуз, дыню а также лука. В данном бизнесе ему помогает жена, старший сын и старшая дочка. Тоир хотел бы получит займ в размере 1600$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена лука сорта «Алдава».

texts.en:
Toir is a conscientious and honest man. He is married and is a loving father of four children. Toir loves his family and tries to provide for them with best living conditions. He wants to see his children in future to be educated, honest and hardworking people. With this purpose he began to grow agriculture crops in 2001. He grows wheat, potatoes, tomatoes, pickles, watermelons, melons and onions. His wife and his older son and daughter are helping him in this business. Toir wants to get a loan in the amount of $1,600USD to buy mineral fertilizer and onion seeds of Aldava brand.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and onion seeds of Aldava brand

loans.name: Sheku

texts.en:
Sheku, aged 43, is married, and has three children aged 18, 15 and 11. He has two other dependants who live with him because they are his mother and father. In 2006, Sheku established his provisions business. He began this business because his previous business was not profitable. Working seven days a week, and 11 hours a day, he earns about 950,000 LE every month from this business. 

Sheku requires a loan in order to buy mayonnaise, sardines, sweet milk and cocoa powder. He would like a loan of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Sheku plans to establish a bigger shop and to establish a branch in Kenema. He also hopes to own a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mayonnaise, sardines, sweet milk and cocoa powder

loans.name: Madewa

texts.fr:
Madewa est une femme âgé(e) de 48 ans. Elle est mariée å un monsieur qui est retraité. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 11 ans.  
Madewa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend du charbon de bois et des céréales à toute personne dans sa maison. Elle est la seule personne impliquée dans son commerce. 
Madewa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et du charbon de bois.. 
Dans les prochaines années, Madewa voudrait voir évoluer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madewa, 48, is married to a husband who is retired. She has three children; two of them are enrolled in school. The oldest is 16 and the youngest 11. 

Madewa has been working as a retailer since 2003. She sells charcoal and cereals to passersby, out of her house.  She is the only person involved in her business. 

Madewa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals and charcoal. 
 
In the coming years, Madewa would like to see her business grow. She says that with the profit she intends to contribute to the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and cereals.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old, married with six children.  He works as a mechanic to earn a living for his family.  He also sells cereals for more income generation.  He has retained his business for five years because of his good services thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him in good customer care.

Maurice hopes to grow his clientele for more income in the future.  He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Kabetou

texts.fr:
Kabétou est une femme  âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon. Elle a 2 enfants, dont un à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 4 ans.  
Kabétou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine, bassines et seaux pour toutes personnes dans un marché local de Lomé. Elle est la seule impliquée dans son activité. 
Kabétou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ustensiles de cuisine, des bassines et des seaux. Elle veut réinvestir dans son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kabétou voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer la vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kabétou, a woman of 33, is married to a mason and has two children; one of them goes to school. The older is 8 and the younger 4 years old. 

Kabétou has been working as a retailer since 2005. She sells kitchen utensils, basins, and buckets to all comers in a local market in Lomé. She is the only person involved in her business. 
 
Kabétou requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy kitchen utensils, basins and buckets. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Kabétou would like to grow her business. She says that with the profits she intends to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, basis, and buckets.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 47 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with three children.

Mario has a rice and corn mill business and earns approximately 30,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He had requested a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase 45 sacks of corn. Mario has been a member of PMPC since this year (2011). In the future, he hopes to expand his store.

loans.use: to purchase 45 sacks of corn

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ifesowakpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFESOWAKPO est composé de huit personnes qui vivent dans la même localité et mènent des activités communes. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Rachidi est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rachidi est âgé de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Rachidi est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Baskatou. Le couple a six enfants à charge dont quatre sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Rachidi a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire, puis a appris le métier de couture. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Rachidi vend depuis quatorze ans des chaussures et des  tissus bazins. Rachidi s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin, et également au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rachidi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFESOWAKPO, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
The IFESOWAKPO group is made up of eight people who live in the same locality and conduct joint activities. This is the second time that this group has sought financial aid from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business. 

The representative of the group, by the name of Rachidi, is the man with the raised hand in the photo. Rachidi is 38 years old and lives in Benin. Rachidi is married to a reseller named Baskatou. The couple has six children dependent upon them, four of which are their own. Some of the children are in school. Rachidi attended school up until high school and then learned the trade of sewing. Aside from this business, which enables him to support himself and provide for the needs of his children, Rachidi has been selling damask fabrics and shoes for the last fourteen years. Rachidi obtains his goods in Nigera, a neighboring state of Benin, as well as in Benin. 

In his quest to satisfy his clients and to increase his sales and his revenue, Rachidi, along with the other members of the IFESOWAKPO group, is seeking a second loan.

loans.use: to purchase damask fabrics and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pop drinks, luncheon meat and powdered milk

loans.name: Goibboy

texts.ru:
Гоиббой честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 1 ребёнка. Его жена домохозяйка. Гоиббой занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить своё жилищное условие, а также обучит свою дочь в хороших университетах. С прибылью, который он планирует, он хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Гоиббой хотел бы получить займ в размере 2600$ США для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Goibboy is an honest and hardworking man. He is married and a loving father to one child. His wife is a homemaker. Goibboy practices animal husbandry and raising crops. He wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions, as well as allow his daughter to study at a good university. Using the profit he has planned, he wants to renovate his home. Goibboy is requesting a loan of $2600 to purchase livestock, with the intent of growing his business.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old, married with three children.  He runs a barber shop to earn a living.  In his barber shop, he also offers services like charging mobile phone batteries for a fee.  In addition, he sells charcoal to supplement his income.

With the income from his businesses, Daniel is able to provide for his family including educating his children.  He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 29-year-old man. He is married and they have two children aged six and three to whom they hope to give a good education to university level. He runs a retail shop at a busy market area known as Kinanie in Kitengela. He has been running this business for two years now and has one employee. 

He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy more general items to grow his business to wholesale and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to diversify into a real estate business in future. He describes himself as honest and understanding.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, detergents, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en: Jestina, aged 43, is married, and has five children aged 20, 17, 14, 11 and eight, all of whom attend school. In 1997, Jestina established her patient medicine business. She began her business to assist her husband in the running of their home. She learnt her business through training at the Nixon Hospital in Segbwema. Working seven days a week, and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 LE every month from this business. Jestina requires a loan in order to buy medicines for her business. She would like a loan of 4,000,000 LE. In the future, Jestina plans to own a modern pharmacy and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her drug store.

loans.name: Enagnon 10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 10 est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent et qui appartiennent au même groupe d’artisans. Le représentant du groupe, du nom Moligui Roger est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Moligui Roger est âgé de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Moligui Roger est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Pauline. Le couple a sept enfants à charge dont six sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Moligui Roger n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Moligui Roger a appris le métier de mécanique. A côté de cette activité, Moligui Roger vend depuis vingt huit ans environs, des lubrifiants. Moligui Roger s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Moligui Roger sollicite un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 10.
texts.en:
The ENAGNON 10 group is composed of three persons who know each other and who belong to the same group of tradesmen. The representative of the group, Moligui Roger, is the one who is raising his hand in the photo.  

Moligui Roger is 49 and lives in Bénin. He is married to a small-scale retailer named Pauline. The couple are raising seven children, of whom six are their biological children. Some of the children are enrolled in school. 

Moligui Roger never went to school. To support himself and his children, he learned the mechanic's trade. Along with this business, he has been selling lubricants for about 28 years. He buys his stock in a market in  Bénin. 

Wishing to satisfy the needs of his clientele and in order to grow his turnover and his income, Moligui Roger is requesting a loan, together with the other members of the group called ENAGNON 10.

loans.use: to buy lubricants.

loans.name: 7 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Minh has a manufacturing business making wooden furniture. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing more materials.

Minh is 41 years old and is married with two children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 7 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. She lives with one dependant in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make furniture

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school.  Harriet operates a restaurant as a business.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works six days out of every week.  Harriet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes. 

The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 37 years old and widowed with two children aged eight and 17.  She runs a salon to earn a living.  Besides this, she sells clothes in order to generate more income.  Caroline has employed two people to assist her in her business. Being a widowed lady with two children in school, she has worked hard to educate her children, thanks to Faulu Kenya for financial support.

Caroline hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes to sell and to renovate her salon.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell and to renovate her salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, plastics, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Lamula

texts.en:
Lamula lives in Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).  Lamula has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week.    Lamula sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income selling charcoal. 

Lamula has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Lamula include the increasing price of charcoal and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. Lamula lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying for electricity, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 29-year-old man. He is married to a businesslady and they have one child aged two years old to whom they hope to give a good education to university level. He sells mangoes and oranges to local people. His business is located within Kakamega town. He has been running this business for three years now and has one employee. 

George says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business  so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy more mangoes and oranges to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In future he hopes to become a wholesaler. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy mangoes and oranges

loans.name: Khotamali

texts.ru:
Хотамали добросовестный и ответственный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей верхних одежд. Более 8 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и старается расширить этот бизнес. Он хочет, чтобы его дети выросли в хороших условиях жизни и стали хорошими людьми. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Хотамали хотел бы получит займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки новых ассортиментах верхних одежд. Он заранее благодарит вас за поддержку!

texts.en:
Khotamali is a conscientious and responsible man. He is married and a loving father to 3 children. He buys and sells outerwear. He has been in business for more than 8 years and is trying to expand his business. He wants his children to grow up in good living conditions and become good people. He want to expand his business and maximize his profits. Khotamali is requesting a loan of $3000 in order to purchase a new assortment of outerwear. He thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: Purchase outerwear

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass, aged 38, is married, and has three children aged seven, five and four. In 1992, Abass established his readymade jeans business. He began his business because he wanted to be self employed and to earn his livelihood for his family. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Abass would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to add to his business, by purchasing sports shoes, men's jeans and short pants. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Abass plans to educate his children to the higher levels and he is very excited about his future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sports shoes, men's jeans and short pants

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en: Genevie is 31 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has two children between 9 and 14 years old. They are in school. For the past two years, she has been selling soap, toothpaste, and chloride air freshener. She started this business with the money that she generated from her graduation program.  She is requesting a loan to purchase soap, toothpaste, and chloride air freshener for her business. Her plan is to build a shop and a house and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase soap, toothpaste, and air freshener for her business,

loans.name: Doris H.

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Doris H. She is married and has four children aged 17, 13, 10 and 7 years old who are all going to school. In 1999, Doris H. established her food and drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in the running of their home. Working five days a week, and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 LE every month from this business. Doris H. requires a loan in order to buy soft drinks, rice, maltina and stout. She would like a loan of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Doris H. plans to locate her business in the centre of town and buy a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, rice, maltina and stout

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from the village Kakabeti in the Kakheti Region. She is 37 years old, unmarried, and lives with her sister Maka, mother, aunt and uncle. Nani and Maka work in the village school. Nani is a teacher and Maka is a school accountant. Nani’s mother, and aunt and uncle are retired. Along with her job, Nani is actively involved in the family agricultural business. The family has a small dairy farm with two cows. Nani sells milk and yogurt to local dairy-product retailers. The family also has one hectare of land where grapes are grown. A portion of the grapes are sold locally, and the rest are used for wine-making. Nani and Maka sell wine in the village. 

Nani requested credit to purchase drugs for treatment of the grapevines for parasites. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for some renovation work in the house. After treating the vineyard, Nani will get a good harvest, and sell it for a convenient price. It will positively impact the income of the family. At the same time, after renovation of the house, the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to treat grapevines for parasites, and materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil and rice for business.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Salamatu. She is a hard working and honest woman.  She is married, and has two children aged seven and fourteen. She has one other dependent, her mother-in-law. In 2001, Salamatu established her palm oil business. She began her business to augment the effort of her husband in running the home. Working seven days-a-week, and ten hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy palm and empty drums. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. In the future, Salamatu plans to build a house, and to give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and empty drums.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Дилшод добросовестный и образованный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. С детства он хотел иметь свой собственный бизнес и стать богатым человеком. Он идет вперед по этой линии, который он мечтал всегда.  Дилшод открыл свой собственный бизнес 2 лет назад и успешно продолжает. Дилшод занимается купля продажей запчасти для автомобилей. В настоящее время Дилшод хочет расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его.

texts.en:
Dilshod is a conscientious and educated man. He is married and is responsible for his 2 children. Ever since childhood, he has wanted to own his own business and become a rich man. He continued along the path he always dreamed of. Dilshod opened his own business 2 years ago and has successfully kept it going. Dilshod buys and sells auto parts. At this time, Dilshod wants to expand his business. To do so, he is requesting a loan of $3000. He hopes that lendors will support him.

loans.use: Purchase auto parts

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 32 years old; she is married and has one child. She runs an electronic shop to earn a living.  She has employed one person to assist her with her business. She is also employed. She was able to start her business with the capital she got from Faulu Kenya. Nancy hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future. She has requested 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sockets, electric cables, and batteries.

loans.use: To buy sockets, electric cables, and batteries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of business clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter ball and okra.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Yatta. She is widowed and has seven children aged 21, 18, 15, 12, 10, 6 and 5, all of whom are in school. In 1996, Yatta established her foodstuff business (selling bulgur, garri and cornflour). She began her business in order to effectively play the role of her late husband as a breadwinner. This business is her only source of income. Working seven days a week, and eleven hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 
Yatta requires a loan in order to buy bags of bulgur, garri and cornflour. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. In the future, Yatta plans to build a back house in her compound, and further support the education of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of bulgur, garri and cornflour.

loans.name: Raw Fish Sellers Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Raw Fish Sellers II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 
The leader of this group is Nancy. She is 23 and was born in Pujehun. She is married to a trader and the couple has one child who is attending primary school. Nancy sells fresh fish and has been in this business for eight months now. Nancy has requested a loan of 500,000 SLL in order to buy a carton of fresh fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy a carton of fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Mama Africa Group

texts.en: This is 52 year-old Laina (holding the folder) from Masvingo, a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. She is married with four children, all attending school.  Laina runs a cross-border retail business selling clothes and shoes. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenges faced are high competition from other sellers at the market. Laina has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes and shoes to meet demand. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the living standards of her family. In the future Laina plans to own a shop to sell goods from and to employ workers.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, flour and rice for her business.

loans.name: Bassirat

texts.fr:
Basirat est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un photographe. Elle a 2 enfants, qui vont tous à l l’école. Le premier a 11 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.  
Basirat travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle  revend du charbon de bois et des chaussures pour ses clients à son domicile. Elle travaille toute seule. 
Basirat a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois et des chaussures. Elle veut aussi commencer la vente de céréales. 
Dans les prochaines années, Basirat voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle pourra assurer une meilleure scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Basirat is a 41-year-old woman. She is married to a photographer. She has two children who all go to school. The first is 11 and the next is 8. Basirat has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells charcoal and shoes to her customers at her home. She works alone. Basirat has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal and shoes. She also wants to begin selling grains. In the coming years, Basirat would like to expand her business. She says that, with the profits, she will be able to ensure better schooling for her children.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yendoubouam

texts.fr:
Yendoubouam est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée à un pompiste. Elle a 3 enfants, tous  à l’école. Le premier a 19 ans ans et le dernier a 6 ans.  
Yendoubouam travaille comme revendeuse de Gâteau depuis 2002. Elle vend des gateaux pour tout le monde dans sa maison. Elle travaille seule. 
Yendoubouam a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des farines de blé et de l’huile. Elle veut avec ce crédit relancer ses activités. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yendoubouam voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle  va contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille pour avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Yendoubouam is a 33 year old woman. She is married to a petrol pump attendant. She has three children who are all in school. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 6 years old.

Yendoubouam has been working as a cookie seller since 2002. She sells cookies to everyone from her house. She works alone.

Yendoubouam has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy wheat flour and oil. She wants to use this loan to revive her business.
Over the coming years, Yendoubouam would like to expand her business. She says that she will use the profits to contribute to her family expenses in order to have a happier family life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and oil.

loans.name: Soniya

texts.ru: Сония проживает в районе Яван. Ей 53 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж работает электриком. Сама Сония занимается торговлей на рынке района. Она в основном занимается торговлей детской одежды и обуви. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 17 лет. Кредит берет для покупки осеней обуви.
texts.en: Soniya lives in the Yavan region. She is married with five children. Her husband is an electrician. Soniya herself is a trader in the neighborhood market. She primarily sells children's clothes and shoes. She has been in this line of work for 17 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fall shoes.

loans.use: Purchase fall footwear

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She did not go to school. She is married and has four children between 1 and 15 years old, all of whom live at home and are in school. Her husband is a driver. For the past three years she has been selling charcoal and plastic bags, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and plastic bags for her business. Her plans are to build her house and sent her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massai is 40 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has two children who are 12 and 19 years old, both of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband works as a carpenter. Massai did not go to school. She has been selling body lotion and body spray for 10 years now. She started  her business at the time she was working as a cook, using her six month salary for her business. Massai is requesting a loan to purchase body lotion and body spray for her business. Her plan is to sent her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion and body spray.

loans.name: Lochinoy

texts.en:
Lochinoy is an experienced and hard-working entrepreneur. For the past 14 years she has operated a grocery sales business. She currently sells a variety of sweets, sausages, oil, canned foods, drinks and other products in her grocery store. Lochinoy has requested a loan to give her additional working capital so she can purchase more inventory for her business.

Lochinoy is married and has 3 children. In addition to taking care of her family, she also helps care for her elderly parents.  Lochinoy has been an excellent client with IMON International, repaying all previous loans with no delays. IMON International is happy to have another opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Try Hard Group

texts.en: Sia, the leader of this group of entrepreneurs, was born in the town of Kailahun 39 years ago. Married to a tailor and the mother of seven children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools, Sia sells clothes for babies. In business for many years now, she has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of baby clothing to resell.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes in large quantity to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more chicken and chicken mash.

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.en:
The business activity from which Muminjon makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business 7 years ago with a small number of livestock. But as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives. According to Muminjon, he works very hard so that he can support his children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve the living of his family. Currently Muminjon needs a loan of 2,300 USD in order to purchase more cattle and later resell after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate all of his children.

loans.use: purchase small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Шамигул жительница Яванского района. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается ремонтом телевизоров, магнитофонов и dvd. Сама она уже 13 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Шамигул арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду и обувь. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Shamigul lives in the Yavan region. She is 39 years old and married, with four children. Her husband repairs televisions, tape records and DVD players. For 13 years, she has been a seller in the market. Shamigul rents a shop where she sells children's clothing and shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase seasonal goods.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal goods

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Mahawa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mahawa was born in Kono city, 29 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. Mahawa sells food items like milk, sugar, flour, etc.

With the help of this loan, Mahawa and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mahawa will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy items like milk, sugar, flour, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is from the village Kolotauri, Keda District, Adjara region. Kolotauri is located in mountainous Adjara and is famous for well-developed bee-keeping. 

Levan is 60 years old. He is married and lives with his family: his wife Tenzile, 31-year-old son, daughter-in-law and two grand-daughters (3 and 1 years old). 

Levan is a teacher and works in the local school. Along with his job, Levan is actively involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, he is leading the dairy farm of the family, with three milk cows. Tenzile produces cheese and sells on average 60 kg of cheese per month on the local market. Also he has 10 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Twice a year he gets on average 150 kg of the honey from the bee-hives and sells it on local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 990 Laris.

Levan requested credit for expansion of his bee-keeping business. He will purchase five new bee-hives with bee-colonies and will get 50% more honey. It will increase annual income of the family by 3600 Laris. Levan will use the increase in income for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase five bee-hives with bee-colonies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salt, Maggi, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Ее муж работает на рынке. Он занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Сама Гулсуной предоставляет услугу. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 11 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Gulsunoy lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 37 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works in the market selling food. Gulsunoy herself provides services. At home she sews ethnic apparel. She has been in this line of work for 11 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is married with 3 children. He owns a small business selling various construction materials and household goods. Alisher has been in this business for 5 years. Alisher's little store is located in the central market. The good location and good prices bring in many customers. Alisher is a very responsible and disciplined person. He has used business loans before and always paid them back on time. This time, Alisher is requesting a loan of 2,280 USD to purchase additional inventory. He hopes to increase sales and to develop his business further.

loans.use: purchase construction materials and household goods in order to increase the range of selling goods

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old and married to John. They are blessed with three children. She has been a mixed crop farmer for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 18,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD. Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and increase her farming and venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ndegbomie Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Ndegbomie” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Satta is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a driver and they have two children attending primary school. Satta has been doing business for many years now; she sells fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of fish.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, wheat, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.en:
Jumaboy is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Jumaboy has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Jumaboy harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. Through this, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Jumaboy requests 1,000 USD for purchasing young cattle. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is twenty-seven-years-old, married and they have three children aged between seven years old and two years old whom she hopes to give good education to the university level. She operates a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, beverages and detergents. She has been in this business for four year and says that though the business is profitable, there are challenges of financial constraints. 

Judith is using her loan of KES 40,000 to buy sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, beverages and detergents to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. In future she hopes to grow her business into a wholesale operation. She describes herself as humble and God-fearing.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta lives in West Point, Liberia. She is 42 years old, married and has two children, 16 and 19 years old. They are in school and live at home. Her husband is a driver. For the past 10 years, she been selling  rice, oil, peppers, onions, and "bitter ball" (an eggplant-like vegetable). One of the problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, "bitter ball", peppers, and  onions for her business. Her dream is to send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, "bitter ball", peppers, and onions.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Margaret who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children aged 17, 15 and 10 years. He has been in his business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of KES 18,000 which he uses to support his family members. He is applying for his 2nd loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

 Francis will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dreams are to venture into dairy farming which he believes will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy farm manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Elimzar

texts.en:
Elimzar is from Teleti, Kartli Region. He is 42 years old, unmarried and lives with his father and elder brother. The main source of income for the family is dairy farming and selling bran. Elimzar’s family has two milk cows. They sell on average 150 liters of milk and 30 kg of cheese per month on the local open market. Also Elimzar sells bran. He purchases it from wholesalers and sells it in Tbilisi, as well as nearby villages. His clients are mostly farmers, who use bran for feeding their livestock and pigs. Total average monthly income of the family, including the pension of Elimzar’s father, is 685 Laris. 

Elimzar requested the credit for purchasing bran, which will be resold. With the borrowed sum he will be able to purchase a big amount of the bran at a cheaper price. It will positively impact the income of the family. Elimzar plans to reinvest most of the profit in the same business, in order to increase turnover and maximize profit.

loans.use: to purchase bran for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Richard Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Richard es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, su señora es comerciante, se dedica a hacer productos chacinados, embutidos caseros, etc. Tiene casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familiar, posee móvil de transporte propio.
Richard se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos, en lo cual cuenta con una antigüedad de más de 10 años.
Comenta que trabaja mucho para darle a su familia todo lo mejor, ya que ellos son su razón de ser. Uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar el horno donde cuece los ladrillos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales indispensables para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Está muy agradecido a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señor Richard is married, he lives in the city of Pilar.  His wife has a business; she works making sausage products, home-made sausages, etc.  He has his own home with comforts for the well-being of his family, and he has his own mode of transport.

Richard works making bricks, which he has been doing for more than 10 years.  He comments that he works hard to give his family the best life possible, as they are his reason for being. One of his dreams is to be able to expand the kiln where he bakes his bricks.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of indispensable materials for making bricks.  He is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and pepper

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more goods for resale

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer
